review: Best way to get there is by tuktuk, it´s about 7 km from Agra Fort and around taj Mahal we see it very close but no way to cross the river, even if you see a boat they are not allowed to get to the banks. Entrance fee is 200 rupees for foreigners.

title: Beautiful garden
review: Mehtab bagh is a entry place of taj mahal mahtab bagh is. So beautiful mahtab bagh is awsm  lovely. So beautiful place

title: Perfect sunset
review: Virgin place .. perfect place for sunset . Romantic not much of crowd ... good place for photographers .. a must visit sight .

title: Great first exposure to Taj
review: Very nice park across the river from the Taj Mahal.

title: Good cross-river Taj Views
review: My main purpose for going to these gardens is to view the Taj Mahal from across the river. Going on a Friday provides great Taj views without people as it is closed that day. Going earlier in the morning will be preferable to the later afternoon when I visited to capture better pictures and more blue in the skies.

title: Sunset view
review: After visiting the Taj at dawn, we chose to watch the sun go down at Mehtab Bagh. it was our last day of sightseeing in India, and gave us the perfect end to the holiday. Along with lots of other travellers, watching the sun go down and the colours of the Taj changing, it was perfect

title: Disappointed
review: There are nice gardens and a good view of the Taj Mahal across the river. We were disappointed not to be able to get closer to the waterfront.

title: Not great about the Gardens, but the "View" of the WORLD Renowned, most rare Monument "TAJ MAHAL"..!!!
review: Note: Appreciate the review by Mr. Ricardo, Congrats!

title: Awesome view of the taj
review: I visited this place with my team on 2nd October for swachta mission. I felt very bad seeing that people throw garbage at such a nice place. It being a tourist place we should be careful about the cleanliness. My team conducted a cleanliness drive here. The view of the taj is really beautiful.. love this place

title: Very good view but a little run down
review: Cost is 200 to get in, which is fine. The place is a little run down and could be made a lot nicer but the view is beautiful

title: One of the three to visit.
review: Smaller scale but still a good trip and worth a visit. Interesting historical buildin. It was hard to get to as the roads on the way from the centre of Agra are very busy so we were in the car most of the time, just one of those things as it was a busy day and in the afternoon, maybe choose the morning to visit.

title: Worth a visit around sunset
review: We visited the gardens on our first evening in Agra and the view of the Taj in the evening sunlight was beautiful. It certainly whetted our appetite for visiting the Taj itself the next morning.

title: Little tourist trap
review: If your guide is taking you for the  view on Taj Mahal at sunset, don't expect too much. From Mehtab Bagh, the park on the other bank of the Yamuna river (entrance fee = 200 rupees per person), you have indeed a very nice view on the Taj. But the sun is not going down behind the monument, as you would expect, but somewhere far to the right. So no breathtaking colours or fantastic pictures, but just... waiting till the sun has disappeared. And then your chased away from the place by whistling guardians, because it's closing time of the park. Bit disappointing...

title: Good views of the Taj Mahal from across the river
review: This is a good place to go on an evening other than a Friday, when it gets crowded as the Taj Mahal is closed on that day.  You get to view the Taj Mahal from across the river and it can be a pleasant place for an hour or so.

title: Stunning view
review: The Mehtab Bagh offers amazing view of the Taj Mahal. We visited at sunset and sat and relaxed in the peaceful garden. The women of the Mehtab Bagh gardens do some incredible work and will always smile for a picture  the price for entry is 200rs which is great value for the views it presents.

title: Must visit spot
review: This is such an amazing place... we went here for pre-wedding shoot and I am glad that we found this place... this is even far better than being in Taj itself..

title: Sunset View of Taj Mahal
review: There is not a great deal here, except the ruins and some gardens. What you do get is a different view of the Taj Mahal from the other side of the river. We visited at sunset, with lovely views set against the fading light. Worth going if you have an hour available.

title: A nice view
review: Opposite the Taj Mahal, Mehtab Bagh offers an alternative view of the Taj, surrounded by lush and expansive gardens.

title: Beautiful at sunset
review: Rumoured to be the place where the Black Taj Mahal was to be built, theses gardens are beautiful to watch the sun go down with the Taj Mahal just across from the river. The grounds are well kept.

title: Mehtab Bag
review: There are different versions of the history of this archaeological structure. What ever said viewing of Taj mahal from here is a feast to the eyes

title: Mehtab Bagh
review: Mehtab Bagh ( Moon Garden ) is Located Opposite of the Taj Mahal..

title: Run down but great Taj views
review: This place is run down. Nothing here but a good view if the Taj. Would not recommend unless you have time to kill.

title: Taj from a different perspective
review: Whenever we think of Taj Mahal, a picture from the front side of the Taj comes to our mind. From this garden on the other side of river Yamuna will give another perspective which is also equally mesmerizing.

title: Good view of Taj
review: We by mistake reached Agra on Friday, forgetting that entry to Tajmahal will be closed on Friday. As we had our further train tickets booked so we were not in a position to extend our stay.

title: Behind the Taj
review: This place is located on the other side of yamuna, behind the Taj Mahal, but what may seem near, is around 15kms drive from taj. The location is a bit remote, but the place is nice and quite, and also away from the hectic crowds.

title: Witness Taj as a midget from afar!
review: Mehtab Bagh, which lies right opposite to the Taj Mahal offers a breathtaking view of the Taj that you absolutely need to witness. Mehtab Bagh is well-known for its luscious green gardens and scenic view because of which it has been vouched for a lot of iconic bollywood movies, documentaries and professional photoshoots. No other spot in the city will make you witness the beauty of Taj like Mehtab Bagh, specially at sunrise and sunset. You can also go for a camel and horse ride right outside the venue.

title: For a rear view of the Taj
review: Even if you are in a hurry to rush to the Taj and tick one item in your bucket list, take some time to visit the Mehtabh Bagh, a garden on the Northern bank of the Yamuan facing the Taj.

title: Interesting
review: If you are coming to Agra, you are undoubtedly planning to see the Taj Mahal, but add this side trip into your plans to see the Taj from the river side. If you get the timing right to see this at sunset, it's special. The grounds are beautiful and our guide told us that there are plans to rebuild the reflecting pool (really really would like to see that)

title: Amazing views of the Taj Mahal
review: Visited at sunrise, to see the Taj Mahal from behind. It was amazing, great unobstructed views with the river in the foreground. Also has the footings for what is said to have been the site for the unfinished 'black taj'.

title: Beautiful Place!!!
review: The Mehtab Bagh place is full of flowers and garden. The Garden is closed at 5:30 PM. Taj Mahal view was excellent from this place. Worthy visit.

title: The View of Taj across the Yamuna River
review: Winding your way down the narrow and often crowded 'gallis' of Agra, one reaches the relatively less crowed Mehtab Baag which is a Mughal Garden. Designed across the Yamuna from the Taj, it is in total symmetry to the gardens of the Taj on the other side of the Yamuna. The garden here will give you fantastic views of the Taj Mahal  and is specially incredible during the monsoon when the river has a huge volume of water.  Take some time out to not only admire the Taj Mahal from different angles but also to understand the water works of the Mughal times in this garden. Don't miss the huge remains of  what used to be a fantastic fountain right opposite the Taj in perfect symmetry. The garden is not particularly well kept and could be better maintained but if you overlook that you will spend some relaxing time just wandering around and admiring the beauty of the monument of love.

title: Relaxing Gardens
review: We came here on both evenings we were in Agra. Our driver brought us the first night and we asked him to bring us back on the second night. It's a great place to view the Taj at sunset. The gardens are relaxing and we just chilled out while being able to look at one of the most famous buildings in the world. Quite a few others doing the same thing but not crowded at all.

title: Great place to see the Taj and beautiful garden with flowers
review: Came here to expect sunset but sky and time did not cooperate but was still able to shoot a moon over the Taj.

title: Beat the crowds and get a great view of the Taj Mahal
review: Unfortunately, it was a hazy day for my visit.  The view of the Taj Mahal was superb.  Try for a clear morning if pos.

title: Sunset didn't happen but still pretty
review: We arrived for a sunset Taj photo but was not fortunate enough to have one.

title: Last stop before the ultimate
review: Afternoon to evening will be a very suitable time to visit here. Should visit before Taj cause once you visit the taj then it has no beauty. This is the place where you can be closest to taj from outside of Taj. Can have a good photo session.

title: A moonlight Garden
review: It is called moonlight garden, located opposite of the Taj Mahal complex  across Yamuna river in Agra. It is a charbagh style square shaped Mughal garden. The park was reconstructed and is now one the best places from which to view the great mausoleum Taj Mahal. Now it's a place of tourist interest in Agra.

title: A place to see the Taj Mahal from another perspective.
review: Do not expect anything special at this place. It is a land that seems to be a garden but in where there are only small trees and shrubs, and it needs much more care. There are some ruins, supposedly of what may have been the tomb of the builder of the Taj Mahal. It is across the river just beyond the Taj Mahal. To access it you have to go through some rather depressing streets. It is a long drive from the city center.

title: Nice
review: Here you can see the back of tajamahal a sign of love ... You can spend time with your loved ones here ... Nice park nd nice view

title: Good view of Taj without the crowd
review: The Mehtab Bagh is situated opposite the Taj Mahal. It's a well maintained garden whose main attraction is the view of the Taj from the back. If you need a view of the monument without the jostling of the crowd, Mehtab Bagh is where you should go. Sunset time is also a good time to be here.

title: Flowers
review: This is a bagh located inside tajmahal.it has a lot of varieties of flowers. It present a beautiful view for the eyes.

title: Good Viewpoint
review: Do you want to avoid crowd? Do you want to take good photo of Taj Mahal? Do you want to see the sunset? Then Methab Bagh is the place that you want to go. It is right across the Taj Mahal, oppoosite bank of Yamuna River. 200 Rs to get inside.

title: The best views of Taj Mahal
review: If you want to have great views from Taj Mahal and a great sunset this is a place to visit. It is unforgettable.

title: Beautiful and Relaxing Garden
review: I loved this place.  A great way to cap off the day with beautiful views of these Taj. I could really see in my mind Shah Jahan strolling these gardens.

title: First glimpse of Taj
review: A great view of the Taj Mahal from this park. If you arrive in Agra late afternoon, this is a good place to visit if you want to see the Taj without the crowds. The park is easy to get to by tuk tuk but traffic on the roads is chaotic, last entry is at 6.30pm. It costs 200INR to the park.

title: Nice place to take a picture of Taj Mahal without the crowds
review: This is a garden across the river from the Taj Mahal.  What makes this place popular is that you get a nice view of the back of Taj Mahal, thus allowing for nice photo ops in this place.

title: Another place to see the Taj Mahal
review: The garden is closed on 5:30. Very few tourists here.

title: Garden
review: Beautiful place full of flowers and natural beauty and have good sunset view and Tak Mahal can be seen easily.

title: Beautiful
review: The view of the Taj Mahal from Mehtab Bagh is just so mesmerising. Taj mahal looks so beautiful from across the river. One who is coming to Agra should also visit this.

title: Perfect for Couple and Youngsters
review: Perfect park for everyone and for every age groups members. This gives a pleasant look of Taj Mahal and Park

title: Overrated
review: Mehtab Bagh shuts down at 7 and the last entry to this bagh is at 6.30pm.

title: Beautiful garden ..... those who love to see nature might visit ..... beautiful flowering plants arranged systematically
review: Nice place to see Taj at sunset.....but we unfortunately missed it as it was cloudy that time.....but we still love the garden it's

title: Excellent place
review: Mehtab bagh is a beautiful place across the Yamuna River as an ideal location for viewing the Taj Mahal.

title: Go!
review: We found the lack of crowds, the symmetrical rows of plantings and the view-- well worth the short drive. You can actually enjoy the Taj without being pushed out of the way for someone else's selfie!

title: Really liked but go to Taj 1st
review: Loved this place but in hindsight we should have gone to Taj 1st. The view from these gardens of the back of the Taj are really good and in fairness you get relatively close. However when we went to see the Taj at 6 the following morning it was a case of we had had a good view yesterday.

title: Very peaceful
review: It costs 200 rupees for foreigners and it provides a very peaceful place to sit and look at the Taj Mahal. Really good to get a photo without the scaffolding in because of the renovation work being done at the moment. The gardens are well kept and would be much nicer when the flowers are in full bloom (went in monsoon season!)

title: Peaceful and green.
review: A beautiful and massive garden with a simple layout and great views of the Taj. Romantic couples will definitely enjoy a visit to this serene place.

title: Nice garden
review: Pretty nice and clean garden with a great view to the Taj and easy access to the riverbank of Yamuna. It is full of squirrels and birds, nice flowers. The entry fee is fair, however it is 14 times more expensive if you are a tourist.:) There are plenty sets for taking photos. Good for those who was also tricked by Taj's closed Friday policy...

title: Taj Mahal at Sunset
review: A definite must see.  Go at sunset so that you get to see the Taj Mahal in that special light.  Take the time to smell the flowers.  The beautiful scents will make you forget that you are in Agra.

title: Worth a trip for the spectacular views of the Taj Mahal
review: Go here for views of the Taj Mahal...it's worth it. It costs 200 INR for a foreigner but it's worth the price. The unobstructed view of the Taj is unparalleled. The garden itself is nice but nothing amazing....go for the Taj view.

title: Excellent
review: We went to Mehtab Bagh at around 5:20 am to catch the sunrise. One day before that, we were in the Taj Mahal and I can say I enjoyed Mehtab Bagh a little more, because there were no tourists and I could take a lot better pictures and better apprciation at the beautiful palace

title: Say wah taj ! from here
review: This is the best place to see the beauty of the Taj without having to deal with the crowd and the lines and guides. Visit this garden early in the morning or evening and get unobstructed view of the Taj and adjacent monuments. You will need a car from your hotels but this garden is a must visit.

title: Taj at sunset
review: This is an ideal place to see the Taj Mahal in a different view. A tuc tuc  ride to the park and a view across the river at the Taj in all its glory. Not really a sunset as you're looking south but still a nice place to sit and reflect away from the crowds. Cost is 200IRs and children under 15 go free. Get there for around 1830 and find a decent place to sit and just relax. There are the normal stalls and local sellers to rid you of your money but a firm "no" works well.

title: Too overpriced for foreigners
review: Too overpriced for foreigners.  If you're here for a view for the Taj there are other areas in the vicinity that will allow for decent pictures.  Not really worth the price of admission if you're coming from a different country.

title: Quiet Gardens with Great Taj Views
review: A cost effective way to see the Taj Mahal away from the commotion. Visit at sunrise or sunset for the best views from low light.

title: The back side of Taj Mahal
review: Not maintained well but visit during sunset to relax and refresh after visiting local sight scenes of Agra.

title: On back of Taj
review: This is opposite side of river offer a great view. However, cost of admission is high esp for foreigners. Not CROWDED place.

title: The Other Side of Taj Mahal
review: This a perfect spot for the non crowded part f Taj Mahal.

title: Great view of taj mahal
review: Go here for sunset or sunrise. Won't be disappointed. Picture from sunrise attached. Tripods not allowed which is a bummer. But view is great. Direct view of taj mahal north face.

title: Beautiful unobstructed view of Taj Mahal with no crowds
review: Mehtab bagh is the place which is just opposite to Taj Mahal and is a place from where you get an unobstructed view of theTaj and one also doesn't encounter the huge crowds otherwise found at the Taj. It is also the place where the foundation stone was laid for a black Taj Mahal which was supposedly was to be built there.

title: Average garden in normal days
review: It is located just opposite to taj. Not so crowded so you can have a nice view of Taj.

title: Taj can be viewed from this garden
review: A big garden opposite TAJ, Not nicely maintained but gives a great view of the monument. Could be avoided visiting it.

title: THE MISSING BLACK TAJ
review: The place is situated on river Yamuna just opposite of Taj.. it is a huge well maintained garden with mysterious structures in between .. one of the locals told me that it was the place were a second taj mahal was to be built but in Black marble..

title: A tricky one...
review: This attraction gave you a beautiful view of the Taj but there's not much more to it than that! Unfortunately for us a young boy latched onto us and followed us around the garden giving us information, we did ask him to take one picture. He would not leave us alone as we left he picked up his tray of magnets and followed us all the way back to the car trying to get us to buy one, we didn't but it did make you feel bad! A nice attraction but not a must see!

title: Lovely PLace Mehtab Bagh
review: Really a very good place in Agra , We reach on Friday at Agra and Know that Taj is close for visitor on Friday, So we Visit Mehtab Bagh in evening around 4:00PM where we found the lot of greenery , Yamuna River and Yes We are Very close to Taj Mahal , So on Friday my family my kids become very happy to see Taj Mahal Closely , Very Nice View of Taj Mahal from Mehtab Bagh, Advise to All must visit Mehtab Bagh Once you are in Agra. Mehtab Bagh from Taj Mahal Aprox 4-5Km.

title: Ok garden with beautiful views of Taj
review: The garden itself is not a WOW and the authorities could do much better at maintaining it however the view of Taj over the river is beautiful. Not so crowded so it is a great place to relax, read a book or take good pictures at sunset or sunrise.

title: This is where you should the next you visit agra.
review: The black taj mahal was supposed to be build here and the foundation is clearly visible. It offers a view of the taj without the hassle of going through so many people. Must try for all Taj fans

title: Best view of the Taj
review: Best place to get a view of the Taj with next to no people. The grounds are also very beautiful. I believe it is under water for part of the monsoon, say may be worth checking before heading out there.

title: The Taj at sunset
review: A garden on the other side of the Yumuna river where you can catch the Taj at sunset time. Place to relax and recharge after a full day of sightseeing. 200 entry fee

title: A Neglected Bagh.
review: In scorching summer heat Nothing Special about it. Although there is a Backside view of Taj Mahal accross the Yamuna River one can find the remains of the foundations of Black Taj mahal the construction of which could not be commenced. There is no Written information about it at site.

title: Mehtab bagh
review: Mehtab bagh os the another famous tourist place in agra..just other side of taj and view of yamuna make place awesome

title: Taj Mahal at sunset on Friday
review: Since Taj Mahal is closed on every Friday so this is an ideal place from where you can have good photographs of sunset/sunrise from backside of Taj Mahal.

title: garden in front of Taj
review: The view of the Tajmahal  from the fountain situated in this garden is best photographic place. It's forever memories with Taj. Good and maintained garden but not much attractive in summer season.

title: The Opposite side of Taj
review: People use to go at this place to see taj from opposite side from the banks of Yamuna River. You will get various pics of this place but it is not currently In that shape. Also, if you are during sunset, you will find Taj very dull in color. One can enjoy this place if he/she visit it in morning.

title: Altertaj
review: Taj from other side. Its less maintained garden right across the Yamuna river. Usually very less populated and site for some snaps with Taj . It was supposed site for the black Taj by shahjahan according to folklore which never materialized. So may be 5 to 10 minute spot.

title: Gr8 view
review: We decided not to go into the Taj Mahal for sunset but see it from the other side of the river. Excellent choice as it was cheaper (200INR pp) and much quieter and spiritual, with the Moon gardens being a pleasant bonus. Even the drive there was interesting through the village. So all in all well worth the detour.

title: A place to view the Taj at sunset
review: We were asked by our guide if we wanted to go here to view the Taj at sunset and of course we said yes as the travel to Agra was because this was a bucket list spot. We later could understand why our guides asked these questions because in India as a foreign tourist every place costs varying amounts of INR to enter. We thought the gardens in the heat of summer were average at best but for us that was not the main reason for being here. My wife has had a knee replacement some six months prior to our trip and she found the long walk over flat ground in the 40 degree heat to the viewing area taxing.

title: Best place to watch beauty of TAJ
review: Instead of entering Taj, one must go to Mehtab Bagh and enjoy the magnificent view of Taj uninterrupted.  Its also a great place for clicking pictures.

title: Best views of the Taj Mahal
review: Mehtab Bagh is a must visit for the best views of the Taj Mahal. Unfortunately the "bagh" which means garden is not the best kept however it is known for its breathtaking views of the Taj. Best time to visit is Sunrise or Sunset.

title: Such an interesting story
review: Our tour guide told us this was the sight of what would have been the black Taj Mahal, so they started with the grounds and outside wall, there are ruins there but the outline of what the Taj Mahal gardens look like and the way it's laid out is perfect, the king was imprisoned by his son so couldn't finish it. Shame. Worth a visit. Amazing birds live there.

title: Interesting
review: This is the garden across the river from the Taj Mahal where the Mughal was going to built his black burial site. His son put an end to this project and he is buried at the Taj next to his wife.

title: A centuries old garden
review: We visited this little known monument as part of our tour in Agra after stayed at Taj Mahal. Mehtab Bagh is a charbagh complex in Agra, North India. It lies north of the Taj Mahal complex and the Agra Fort on the opposite side of the Yamuna River, in the flood plains. The garden complex, square in shape, measures about 300 by 300 metres and is perfectly aligned with the Taj Mahal on the opposite bank. Was an extraordinary day at Agra.

title: a beautiful view of the Taj
review: The Mehtab Bagh (park/gardens) is well worth a visit, specially later in the day, before sunset - the view of the Taj Mahal from over the river gives another fabulous perspective of this wonderful World Heritage.

title: Beautiful
review: Such a nice view from here. Too bad it closes so early. A little difficult to find the place. Still one must visit for a sunset view of a Taj.

title: Forgotten park
review: This is a park that is not visited by many tourist.  From here, you can view the Taj from across the river.  Recommendation is to go towards the late afternoon with the late sun light.  The view here is just different from the other side of the Taj.  The entrance fees for foreigners is 200 INR (in my opinion on the high side since there is basically nothing else here besides to see the Taj).  On my visit, I was for the first time not given an official ticket after paying the fees, so not sure if the money goes into their own pockets or upkeep of the park.  There are few touts, but not much of an irritation.

title: Good place to end the day but a little expensive
review: This was a quiet and peaceful way to end our hectic day of sight seeing. The view of the taj was excellent and the gardens were pretty enough.

title: Bery beautiful park and place
review: This plce was very good the smell are very mind-blowing and i am was site in the middle of park feeling goods.

title: Nature beauty & Picture perfect place for pics with Taj in Background
review: For people who loves natural beauty & who are photogenic, this is a must place for them to visit. This place will give you awesome pictures if your skills are good. If you are professional photographer, dont forget to carry your awesome lenses with you here.

title: Another view of magnificent Taj
review: Taj is a wonder and looking at it from various angles gives different perspective and reveals different beauty. So not much to see at Mehtab Bagh, but worth visiting to see Taj from other side of Yamuna during sunset.

title: Don't just see it from there...
review: But if you can do everything, than see the Taj Mahal from Mehtab Bagh at sunset too. It is a nice add on (and a nice souvenir picture)

title: Fantastic Sunset views
review: At least 30 mins from Central Agra, arrive about 430pm to enjoy the best light for great photos of the Taj Mahal across the river.

title: Great view
review: There is no a garden, only some trees and ruins.

title: Sunset with Jamuna & Serenity!!
review: To watch Sunset in Agra??? You must go Mehtab Bagh and you will get Sunset with Jamuna & Serenity!! View of Taj mahal from here is also worthy. In my opinion one of Must visit place along with family or friends.

title: Beautiful view of the Taj at sunset!
review: This is a bit of drive from the centre of Agra on the other side of the Yamuna river, but definitely worth a trip for the new perspective. Very peaceful place to see the Taj from away from the hustle and bustle of central Agra.

title: Nice Garden, Great Sunset View
review: This is a nice and beautiful garden for evening strolls. It is quite well maintained and the Taj backdrop provides a magnificent feel to it.

title: Visiting Agra
review: One of my favorite view of Taj is from here. But I would suggest in summers to visit the place early in the morning or after 4:30pm

title: Should visit for lush green gardens  with a view of taj in background
review: Located on other side of river yamuna opposite the Taj , it is not as crowded as Taj  . Offers good photo opportunity with Taj in background.

title: sunset view is unreal
review: if you visit the mehtab bagh, don't forget to visit during sunrise and sunset. the views are just spectacular. i fell in love with the taj mahal view from this spot. it is not close to taj, a short drive, but it is pretty. also the garden is very beautiful for couple pictures

title: Place is not maintained well!
review: Good place to visit if kept clean! We can find ppl on a mission(sitting for toilet!!) if you visit in the evening!

title: Great view of Taj Mahal
review: We got up not very early the first day in Agra, and the hotel staff told us we should not go to the Taj in the afternoon. Too hot and crowded. Instead we choose to go to Mehtab Bagh around 17h. Very nice with a fantastic view. Friendly people, not too many, gathering near the bank of the river. Interesting garden and some birds to watch as well. Definitely recommended.

title: Taj mahal view
review: Average spot. Nothing but a normal garden. Only attraction is the Taj mahal view. If you have extra time you visit once.

title: Tranquility  and beauty
review: You can take good pictures with Taj Mahal in the background from this place.Mehtab Bagh is a pleasant garden full of trees, birds and flowers so if you wish to walk and rest a bit in a quiet place, this is it.

title: Worth the pictures
review: Nice view of the taj from a different viewpoint. Worth the pics if you have the time. Maybe arrange a transport to go and comeback because its not really a busy spot.

title: Lot of scope for improvement
review: This is a garden located close to the bank of Yamuna. It is a lush green garden with lawns, flowering plants, shrubs and trees.  We visited in the evening. Nice views of Taj Mahal could be seen from here. It was a perfect destination to click few good photographs. There is lot of scope to improve the maintenance of the garden.

title: Views.
review: As previous reviews have stated this a great spot to take undisturbed photos of the Taj Mahal. However, I found it fascinating watching the locals going about their daily lives.

title: Undisturbed view of Taj Mahal
review: Luscious Green and clean Park set just behind the Taj Mahal across the River Yamuna. People in evening can visit for the sunset of Taj. Good spot for clicks with beautiful background.

title: Unparalled view away from the crowd
review: It's definitely worth a visit as it gives you a different perspective of the amazing Taj Mahal. The garden is very calm and peaceful and a good way to relax and enjoy taj away from the crowd

title: come for sunset
review: my guide recommended to visit this side of the Yamuna river  to see the Taj Mahal at sunset. great recommendation !

title: Good option, only if you are on a leisurely trip lasting at least 3 days
review: It is directly befind Taj Mahal, across the Yamuna. Also the site where a black Taj Mahal would have come up if Shah Jahan has is way. Thanks to the ASI the gardens are well maintained. There is not much to see except just a different view of Taj so put it in your itenary if you already have seen the Taj, Fatehpur Sikri and Agra Fort and still have time to spare and an inclination to know more about the history. Not worth staying and extra day or running through it if you are tired or short of time.

title: A different view of the Taj
review: Nice, symmetrically laid out garden, which is still under restoration.  Unfortunately, you can't get all the way down to the river, but location still provides great views and photos of the Taj Mahal from a different perspective than is usually pictured.

title: A different view of Taj
review: ASI has started maintaining the gardens and hence making it more easier to walk... this place is mostly visited in the evenings at the time of sunset and should be only kept towards the end of the Agra trip after visiting Taj Mahal. Agra Fort and Fatehpur SIkri

title: Nice additional view of the Taj
review: This is essentially a massive garden with a nice view of the Taj. Didn't expect to have to pay, but it's only 200/300 rupee (can't remember which) and it goes towards conservation so that others can visit this lovely landmark. Only downside is that it's a bit out of the way, but this meant it was almost deserted and it's actually quite close to the baby Taj.

title: Beautiful view of the Taj
review: Mehtab Bagh is what is also popularly known as the site of the Black Taj. It is exactly on the opposite side of Taj and gives a brilliant view of the Taj especially during the sunset..

title: Back View of the Taj
review: This is the place from where you get an excellent back view of the Taj, I went there early morning and when you get a chance to see the Taj its just mesmerising. First of all you cannot see the Taj because of the trees, but when you go past them, suddenly a massive structure is in front of you. Wow it was a point to watch the Taj mahal from.

title: To get an undisturbed view if Taj
review: To get an undisturbed view of Taj from the other side of Yamuna. People come here, lie down and look at Taj for hours together. It wasn't very crowded when it went either. Must visit!

title: Only for view of Taj Mahal
review: These gardens are nothing special - but at least clean. You have to pay 200 rupees to go in and the gardens have only really been made so that you can ge a view of the Taj. Tourists go there at sunset to take photos of the Taj - not sure if we really understood why taking photos at this time is supposed to be spectacular. However, you do get good views at any time of the day.

title: Great place!
review: We went here as a first look of Taj Mahal, what a great experience

title: Great view of the Taj
review: Great place to get pictures of the Taj Mahal without all the crowds. We went there on Friday while the Taj was closed and it was great for getting photos without so many people in the background. The gardens weren't that impressive but maybe that's due to the time of year we were there.

title: A perfect view
review: There is something special about seeing the Taj from a distance.  This viewpoint is more peaceful and the river in evening light is a picturesque setting

title: View of Taj Mahal from across the river, at sunset
review: Mehtab Bagh, the beautiful park area across from the Taj Mahal, is the perfect place to see the Taj Mahal at sunset. There are a few benches where people can rest, if they cannot reach the stone walls closest to the river. When the Taj Mahal is closed on Fridays, tour guides take their guests to Mehtab Bagh. It’s also about 140 metres from the parking area to the benches under the shade trees along a dirt path or across the grass.

title: Sunset views of the Taj Mahal
review: I'm happy that we visited Mehtab Bagh for sunset the day before we visited the Taj Mahal. It offered a great 'first glimpse' of this incredible monument.

title: Unparalleled view of the Taj Mahal
review: This lush green large garden built on the banks of the river terrain that separates it from the Taj Mahal grounds offers unparalleled views of the Taj from a distance. Go there to witness the dreamy, awesome and magnificent Taj during the sunset hours and for photos of the Taj that you simply cannot take from anywhere else in Agra. What you also get as a bonus is a really cool garden, with lots of birds and flowers and tree canopies.

title: It's really up to Mother Nature
review: The Moon light Garden is located on the backside of the Taj Mahal, across the river. This is where tourist tend to go to see the Taj at sunset. It is worth a visit, but of course the quality of the sunset is up to Mother Natures desire to please.

title: Alternative and less busy view of the Taj Mahal.
review: A wonderful drive around Agra and through a long windy country road brought us to the entrance of the Mehtab Bagh, There were buses and taxis lining both sides of the road and it was quite chaotic , however once inside the gardens the crowds seemed to disappear and we had a five minute walk to the river edge and wonderful views of the river and the Taj Mahal. Slightly to the right hand side of the Taj there were cremations taking place on the ghats. I could not help but wonder at the site of perhaps the worlds most magnificent tomb and the more worldly end that the rest of us poor mortals are likely to have.

title: A Beautiful View, Especially at "Golden Hour"
review: I headed to Mehtab Bagh the evening before our visit to the Taj Mahal itself. It does cost money to get in, but I knew I'd only be in Agra once and the view from this side of the Yamuna is worthy as well. It is much quieter than the experience of battling fellow tourists on the other side of the river, and the green of the gardens adds some nice dimension to your photos. Go towards sunset for some beautiful, soft lighting.

title: 200r Entry for Foreigners!
review: We did not expact that visiting a simple park costs entry and guards are checking at the gate... At least you have a nice view to Taj Mahal - the reason why we go there...

title: Views for days
review: Walking through the grounds the first thing that comes to mind is "plenty". Here you'll hear the birds chirping, see flowers blooming, trees with fruit dripping... and all facing the most glorious tribute to love, the Taj Mahal. We sat in the garden for a good few hours watching the sun set on the glorious white marble spectacular, and then made our way slowly back to the car. Be careful about taking food and juice into the space (keep it in your bag).

title: Fair
review: We are glad we went but would not recommend it as it is out of the way and not very special. Little shade and as yet few flowers. Will improve I think with time. Can get better views of taj from Nature walk near East gate

title: Another view of the Taj Mahal.
review: You’ve traveled so far to see the Taj you might as well see it in all its opportunities. The Metab Bagh, is a rundown garden so not so great on its own and is now fenced off so you cannot get up very close to the river -the river is dried up most of the time anyway. Go at dusk to get the best view. Get a driver to take you and wait for you. Combining this visit with the tomb of Itimad ud Daulah, aka “Baby Taj” and the inspiration for the Taj Mahal is efficient time spent.

title: Sunset but cloudy
review: This says it is a protected monument , but only a few rocks there, so it is just a very simple garden area , but directly across the river from the Taj Mahal.

title: Good Leg-Stretch
review: The gardens themselves might be a rather a non-event but visiting this site does provide a useful leg-stretch when you are visiting the N side of Agra and the Itmad-ud-daula Tomb.  It also provides a different view of the Taj and the Yamuna river on its way to join the Ganges.  You may also be able to get a useful photo of the setting sun from here - or even of a camel!

title: Could be more well decorated.
review: The view of the Taj Mahal from here is really nice, but the garden itself is nothing spectacular, Could be more well decorated.

title: Good for photos of the rear of the Taj Mahal
review: I'd heard this this was a great spot for taking photos of the Taj Mahal. You will need to get a lift here adn possibly ask teh driver to wait as you will only stay for maybe one hour. There is a charge of 200 rupees (€3.00) but it was worth it.

title: Ultimate Spot to see the TajMahal of Agra.
review: Built by Emperor Babur,who had a fascination of gardens & we could get a sense of those .The place has a direct view of the Taj.According to me it's offers a beautiful view  & a photographer's delight. Also going there over the old bridge from Agra city itself is a lively experience.

title: Cool spot to check out
review: Entrance was 200 INR per person and it didn’t look like they took credit card. It was a great view of the back end of the Taj Mahal and cool to see the remnants of what was supposed to be the black Taj Mahal. Also a great place to ponder.

title: Absolutely loved it
review: Soy out can see the view of Taj Mahal frOm here .. This was also the site where black taj was supposed to be made .. Can see some excavated sites for it.. The view of taj across a Amana is awesome especially during sunset .. It's a very calm and serene place and has way lesser tourist.. So get nice shots and time to enjoy

title: A magical view of the Taj Mahal
review: I read a review that said this vantage point was almost a secret.  (Yea right, maybe 20 years ago)

title: An more peaceful view of the Taj
review: This is a park on the opposite shore of the Yamuna River. It's a nice place to sit in peace watching the sun go down over one of the most famous buildings in the world.

title: Quiet park - wonderful views
review: Great park from where you can get a great view of the Taj Mahal while enjoying some peace and quiet away from the crowds.

title: A good photo-op place for the Taj Mahal.
review: This quiet corner of the city, on the other bank of the river, serves as both a garden (which was quite neglected when we visited it) and as a view point of the wonderful Taj Mahal.

title: Great view of the Taj
review: It is beautiful, though not all that well maintained. The view of the Taj is lovely. You can imagine the setting back in 1700's

title: Nicely Maintained
review: Inside Taj Mahal, Nice, Straight Garden, you can see it in one view and from one eye it looks perfectly staright

title: View of Taj from other side of Yamuna
review: Shouldn't miss this view from the other side of the Yamuna looking towards the Taj Mahal.  Some restoration is occurring to the site presently with hopes of returning the gardens to their previous glory.

title: Different View of the Taj
review: This is a great place to visit after you visit the Taj Mahal.  It's not as crowded and in a more quiet area.  While not as grande, or as well maintained, it provides an important piece of history.  The gardens were not super well maintained, but walking through the building and hearing the history behind Mehtab Bagh is why you go.  You can get a distant view of the Taj Mahal, with a different view.

title: Visiting agra on a Friday
review: Dont worry if you find Taj Mahal closed on a Friday. Go for Mehtab bagh and you will be get the same feel!

title: Another view of the Taj
review: The viewing of the Taj would not be complete if you do not cross the River Yamuna and look at it from Mehtab Bagh, the spacious garden...

title: Beautiful garden with magnificent view
review: Mehtab bagh the moonlight garden on the left bank of the river yamuna one of the best view of taj mahal and a perfect location to see the sunset with the taj mahal..

title: Good sunset spkr
review: Did not think the gardens were all that. What you are coming here for is to see the back side of the Taj Mahal at sunset. The sun went down  on your right, over the river, with the Taj on the opposite side.

title: Golden Triangle tour
review: We visited this site at sunset to view the Taj Mahal from the opposite bank of the river. Very interesting to see the recently discovered site. And what a view of the Taj. Takes the breath away!

title: Spectacular sunset views of the Taj Mahal
review: I visited during sunset on a perfectly clear day in February. It sits across the river from the Taj Mahal, and provides a perfect view of it.

title: Mehtab just awsome
review: Loved the gardens. Give a different perspective on the Taj. Go for sunset and watch the Taj change colors as the sun sets in the distance. The place is not crowded and auto rick-shaws are not expensive.

title: You wont see the moon at the moon garden
review: There are great views from the Taj from here. However you get ushered out  before the sun has set and way before the moon has risen.

title: Taj at a Distance
review: A small park on the opposite side of the river which offers you a distant but clear view of The Taj Mahal. A great spot to get an idea of the breathtaking beauty that awaits.

title: A more relaxed way to view the Taj
review: A train delay meant we had to adapt our plan, we couldn't get to the Taj in the early morning. However, Mehtab Bagh was a nice relaxed way to view the Taj from the opposite bank. The drive to the east bank is full of streetlife, movement and vibrant colours. A real photographic feast if you're quick enough. Yes there are touts and guides and beggers near the entrance, but it's easy to get to the ticket booth and once inside there are lush gardens and a great view of the back of the Taj. There are fewer tourists here and a lot more room to take photos. The river was low when we visited but still had boats and some lovely scenery along the bank. There are gardeners here and construction so some areas will be blocked off, but overall a nice wide garden and a  great alternative the Taj itself.

title: Viewing spot of the Taj Mahal
review: Mental Bagh a century old garden is located on the northern shores of the Yamuna River. The Mughal garden was build in the early 1500's as the viewing place of the Taj Mahal.

title: Amateur Photographers!! Don't miss this
review: Early morning visit to Mehtab bagh is even better than the night viewing of Taj.

title: Excellent view of the Taj!
review: The best view of the Taj Mahal from outside the actual precincts of the monument.

title: Romantic and Peaceful Garden
review: this is the place in the back side of the famous Tajmahal where you can seat comfortably with your friends, relatives and family members and can enjoy the view of Taj mahal from back side.

title: VIsit only for the view
review: The view of the Taj from across the Yamuna is the only reason to visit the place. The garden itself was destroyed so there isn't much to see. It is now being developed by the tourism department by planting trees and reviving the old plan, so will be an attractive destination in a year or two. A good location for a sunny picnic with Taj in the backdrop. Though there are no eateries or food outlets in or around.

title: Only there for the view
review: Really no reason at all to go here...except for an across the river view of the Taj Mahal, which is stunning. The area itself rather beat up and dilapidated, and do not expect any help from the guards or anyone else there.

title: Was it worth it?
review: Hum, what can I say except you get a view of the Taj. As for the gardens don't expect too much. No flowers etc. just a few brushes and trees set in scrubland. The most exciting part of this place was watching a litter of pups leave their den for the first time.

title: A place they want you to pay again
review: If the weather is good, and you want the view of Taj Mahal in sunset, it is a good place to go. Not many people, quiet. But in dry season, not much water in the river. They have  fences built outside of Mehtab Bagh and even have the security guard there to prevent the people to get close to the bank. So, unless you pay Rs200 to get in the park,  you could not get a view of Taj Mahal across the river. A bit far away of the town, I think I paid Rs200 for one way for Tuktuk.

title: Best scenes attractive looking
review: Nice place to see lot of thing that beyond imagination. Historical thing that really nice to see here.

title: A different view of Taj Mahal
review: centuries old garden, Moonlight garden, on the northern shore of Yamuna river, provides a different view of Taj. I was told by the tour company that this is the place to be for sunset view of Taj across the Yamuna river. Unfortunately the sky was not clear due to smog but still worth a visit.

title: Garden in front of Taj mahal.
review: This is the beautiful garden in front of Taj Mahal. When you enter the gate of Taj Mahal you will see this. But when you are behind the gate you will not see this garden and will feel that the Taj Mahal is near. This will appear as soon as you cross the big gate.

title: Mehtab Bagh
review: This is a garden located across the Yamuna on the side opposite Taj Mahal. The main purpose to visit this garden is the alternate view of Taj that this location offers.

title: No. 1 at Agra
review: Probably the best place in Agra to go for. It is a big open garden, just at the back side of Taj. The view is really eye-catching. One can enjoy as much time as he wants without any extra restrictions or security. Me and my family really rejoiced being here. We visit here on day one, and went to visit Taj the next day. It was just perfect (Y)

title: Dirty
review: We took 30 minutes to get here from the main hotel district. The drive was more interesting than the garden. You will pass some ragged tent homes and then many vendors.  The "garden" is just a dusty dirty area with a residual brick foundation. The only worthwhile result is a view of the back of the Taj. Costs  $US3 to enter. Is it worth it? Probably, if you have the time.

title: Not the gardens but sunset behind the Taj Majal
review: The gardens are a pleasant walk. They are also surprisingly quiet. However, the real reason is to see the Taj Mahal at sunset and if you can manage this it really is truly memorable.

title: Great view behind Taj Mahal
review: We enjoyed the flavor of the neighborhood around the area. You can even take a camel ride. We paid for the garden, which isn't much of a garden currently but the view was great. No crowds.enjoyed view of the bilateral mosques and the Taj from behind.

title: The best of View of the Taj in a relaxing location
review: This was where I got my first view of the Taj, and even though it's awesome to be on the grounds of the Taj and be able to see all the ornate detail up close, I continue to think back, not only on the view from these gardens, but also the peace, quiet and tranquility I experienced, being here just before sunset....as opposed to the frantic nature of the Taj at the same time of day with literally thousands of tourists jockeying to get their last photos before it closes.

title: Beautiful view of Taj
review: This garden is across Taj Mahal, beside Yamuna river. We went around sunset time and had a magnificient view of Taj. Not a lot of crowd, you will get all the oppurtunity to take your picture without thousands of people infront of you. it is a must see place.

title: See the Taj Mahal from the Gardens
review: It's the middle of winter in India so the gardens of Mehtab Bagh weren't in full flower, though they are still a lovely quiet, reflective place to walk around.  However, there's no doubt that these gardens are popular with tourists for one reason - and that is to view the Taj Mahal from its rear side, across the River Yamuna.  Get there at the right time (and be prepared to pay for the privilege) and you can stand on a currently-being built platform to watch the sun set over the Taj. We weren't there for that but it would be magnificent.  Also interesting just outside the gardens, is a small village community.

title: Planned foundation of the second Taj Mahal
review: As the title already said: there is only the foundation of a planned second Taj Mahal  of black marble not much to see but I'm sure on a sunny day the view of the Taj Mahal from this side of the river would be fantastic. Around the area are gardens and outside the entry are many children who sell Taj Mahal souvenirs like Taj Mahal snow globes, Keychain 10 pcs for 100INR if you want to buy small cheap souvenirs as a gift then buy it here or in a street shop outside of the Taj Mahal. In the actual Taj Mahal shops there are miniatures out of real marble which cost about 2000 INR depends on how you bargain.

title: Best Place for the Good View of Taj
review: WoW is the word for this place, the view of Taj from here is breathtaking, it was even clearer than seeing Taj from the front.

title: A sunset must!
review: THE best place to view the Taj Mahal at sunset. You need to get a taxi/tuk-tuk over the river to get here but it is worth it. Only INR200 (non-indian residents) and uninterrupted views across the river.

title: Not really worth visiting
review: We went here expecting to take fabulous photos of the Taj from another angle across the river.  But it was very cloudy so I don't think that it is worth the time or the entrance fee of 200 rupees pp to visit.  Many local people were picnicking on the park grounds.

title: Unimpressed
review: Not really a garden so much as rows of smallish trees desperately holding on despite dubious grounds keeping and a general lack of attention.  Yes, you can see Taj Mahal across the water although you'll be viewing the shaded side and it wasn't as impressive of a view as we'd hoped.  The best part of the visit to Mehtab Bagh was the entry sign which noted that "indecent acts in the garden are prohibited" by order of the chief horticulturist, which my friend and I spent days laughing about.

title: View of the Taj from different angle.
review: This garden is very well deigned and maintained. Although nothing much to see here but you get to see the Taj Mahal from a different angle. Nice place for photography. Not much rush, you can enjoy some quiet and private time here.

title: Taj from across the river....
review: Heard a lot of historical tales about this Mughal garden and view of Taj Mahal from across of river. Except the view of Taj Mahal, which is also not quiet clear due to fog and pollution during winter there is nothing attractive about this place. The place is quiet and very few visitors come here. ASI had carried out some excavation but what it depicts is no where mentioned. Authorities are though maintaining the places by sowing new samplings and plants.

title: Back side view of Taj
review: Metab Bagh is opposite side of Yamuna river and back side of the Taj Mahal. Place is not developed,just plans and tree. but you can enjoy nice view of the Taj Mahal.

title: Mehatab Garden
review: Hi guys

title: A nice quiet garden overlooking the mighty Taj Mahal
review: This garden is quiet, tranquil and overlooking the Taj with a commanding view.

title: Not a very nice place for so much money
review: Nice view of the Taj Mahal from the back side, however not worth for two hundred rupees (non Indian citizens).

title: Great view of Taj
review: I went to the Taj Mahal in the morning before it got to crowded and, as expected, it was utterly magnificent. After a tour of the Agra fort, I took a 25ish minute cab ride to Mehtab Bagh.

title: Back view of Taj Mahal
review: The first day when we reached Agra we were slightly late to visit the Taj mahal, never the less we hurried to get the back view of Taj Mahal - which looks same from all four directions so telling back would be unjustified.

title: View of Taj Mahal
review: My first photos of the Taj Mahal, in the late afternoon, were from the banks of the Yamuna River.  The park is quiet and a great place to capture views of the famous monument without crowds. Didn't know there was an entry fee as nobody stopped me at the entrance.

title: A must visit for Taj Mahal enthusiasts.
review: Not much os a Bagh though, but a must visit for Taj Mahal enthusiasts. Sunset view Taj Mahal Mehtab Bagh is breathtaking and worth a visit.  Normal visit during daytime is also worth the effort.

title: Ignore the unkempt garden, focus on the Taj
review: Go at the beginning of sunset and be wowed by the emergence of pink on the marble of the Taj. So much has been written, so many photos taken; these alone are a wonder of the world.

title: No need to visit
review: if you going to Taj Mahal from front side actually no need to go there. This is to view  Taj from back side across river.

title: Taj Mahal View
review: Supposed to be the best view from the back of the Taj Mahal

title: When a man loves a woman
review: To think how much a man loved his wife. Heart broken and then imprisoned by his own son, so that he would stop his love sickness, breaks ones heart.

title: Nice Views. Not a Must-See
review: If the weather is nice this would be a nice relaxing way of viewing a nice garden as well as some nice views of the Taj the evening before you go. We did have a guide. A guide wasn't necessary, but he did take some great pics of us "interacting" with the Taj.

title: Possibly the best place to view the Taj Mahal
review: This is a small park on the other side of the river to the jaw-droppingly beautiful Taj Mahal. Go there late in the afternoon when the sun is on the nearmost face and you can gawp at your leisure without the hordes of people taking selfies.

title: Moonlight Garden, they said
review: We didn't get it. Maybe it's the time of year but there just wasn't any oomph. Yes, you can see the Taj from here. But it's a walk from the car park to end up.... don't hold your breath.

title: Taj View Park
review: My husband liked being able to take photos of the Taj from this park. I enjoyed the long distance views from it. Orchards have been planted--guavas and pomegranates.

title: You can skip this
review: Only attraction to visit this place is view of the Taj from the other back of the river. Yes, view is good but nothing exceptional. You can get better pics by visiting taj itself.

title: Anniversary trip
review: Its best way to view taj from back side. Also place were Sahajhan originally planned to built black marble replica of taj.

title: Some piece and quit in Agra, with the most amazing views
review: Thought they did recently triple the entrance fee to a roaring 300 INR, it's still a very nice and peaceful place to get some extraordinary views of the Taj.

title: Backside view of Taj
review: If you want some beautifull view of taj in a nature. Please visit. about 10 min from agra fort. Ticket: 15/- for Indian. 01 hrs is enough for this place.

title: Good
review: Fine and garden is now under development,it will be good in future.The beauty of Taj is extraordinary from this side

title: View the Taj from quiet gardens
review: This lesser known and visited gardens was to be the site of the Black Taj Mahal. See the replica fountain and the foundations of another Taj Mahal that sadly was never built. Walk through the pretty gardens and view the Taj from the other side of the river.

title: Not a must-do but if you're in Agra anyway, why not
review: Mehtab Bagh is a garden complex opposite the Taj Mahal, across the river, with unobstructed views to the Taj Mahal. It is a popular place to come before sunset to view the Taj Mahal from another side. Access to the gardens cost ₹200 per person, and note that the gardens close immediately after sunset, but if you enjoyed your visit to the Taj Mahal, this is a nice place to spend the evening.

title: Historic gardens to get a unique view of the Taj Mahal across the Yamuna
review: The Gardens may seem right opposite to the Taj Mahal, but reaching them through road takes time and distance.

title: Best view of Taj from back side
review: Mehtab Bagh is on the back side of Taj Mahal. It is across the river Yamuna. You get the best back side view of Taj Mahal. The garden complex, square in shape, measures about 300 by 300 metres (980 ft × 980 ft) and is perfectly aligned with the Taj Mahal on the opposite bank. It is also noted that Emperor Shah Jahan had identified a site from the crescent-shaped, grass-covered floodplain across the Yamuna River as an ideal location for viewing the Taj Mahal. It was then created as "a moonlit pleasure garden called Mehtab Bagh." White plaster walkways, airy pavilions, pools and fountains were also created as part of the garden, with fruit trees and narcissus. The garden was designed as an integral part of the Taj Mahal complex in the riverfront terrace pattern. Its width was identical to that of the rest of the Taj Mahal. Legends attributed to the travelogue of the 17th century French traveler Jean Baptiste Tavernier mention Shah Jahan's wish to build a black marble mausoleum for himself, as a twin to the Taj Mahal. Must Visit. Can be reached from Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah side.

title: Nice gardens
review: Mehtab Bagh (Hindi: मेहताब बाग़, Urdu: مہتاب باغ‎, translation: Moonlight Garden) is a charbagh complex in Agra, North India. It lies north of the Taj Mahal complex and the Agra Fort on the opposite side of the Yamuna River, in the flood plains.

title: Lovely views of Taj
review: Not the most amazing gardens but they are working on them but lovely views across the river of the Taj Mahal, worth the visit for the views.

title: Mehtab Bagh
review: The view of Taj Mahal from mehtab bagh is really awesome sun rise or sun set time is the best time to visit this place . They charge 15 INR for each entry .

title: Best view of TAJ
review: You get best view of Taj Mahal from this garden. Best time to be there is evening. It's open till 6pm. But I think this place should be open till 7.30. On the full moon day this place should be open till at least 8.30 pm with extra tickets.

title: Can watch & admire beauty from here......
review: Visited there in the evening, after reading so many reco in tripadvisor. It worth spending 2/3 quality evening hours here till sunset. You can seat under a tree on a stone bench and look at Taj's elevated view.

title: Not worth ot
review: This garden is a bit out of the way to get to. We paid 200 INR for entry and there was not much in the garden at all. Definitely not worth it on a budget. We could see the Taj Mahal over the river but you can get a better view from taking a right before the eastern gate entrance and following the road round to the river - this is completely free.

title: Spectacular view.
review: We came here the evening before visiting the actual Taj Mahal complex and it's a gorgeous view across the river, especially as the sun sets.

title: to see the Taj Mahal at sunset
review: There is a platform to stay until the sunset  and you can take pictures when the sun goes down and the Taj Mahal looks different every few minutes.

title: The most beautiful view of Taj can we seen from Mehtab Bagh
review: The most beautiful view of Taj can we seen from Mehtab Bagh. This shows the real clear rear view of Taj Mahal.

title: Nice view
review: Its worth it if you dont find what to do.  Nice view of the taj mahal on the other side of the river.

title: Great spot for beautiful view of Taj Mahal
review: This area is really nice with a well-treated park. We could capture a great  picture of the Taj Mahal from here. But to go here in the morning is not a really nice idea since the Taj fully covered by the fog. I heard that government wants to make this location as a wedding place.

title: Beautiful gardens
review: These gardens are stunning and they are situated on the opposite bank to the Taj Mahal with views of the river yamuna makes a stunning photograph well worth a visit.

title: A great photo opportunity
review: The site itself is not particularly impressive as it's work in progress.

title: Nice View of Taj Mahal
review: Mehtab Bagh is located back side of Taj Mahal. Yamuna river is inbteween the Taj Mahal & Mehtab Bag. This BAgh is not maintain. Only this is famous for back view of Taj Mahal.

title: Visit early morning
review: The best place to see Taj. Try to go early in the morning. Around dusk you will be facing the sun rays at an angle and the pictures might become dark.

title: Gorgeous Park with Brilliant View of Taj Mahal
review: Mehtab Bagh allows you to get a decent view of Taj Mahal from across the river, and that too from within a park.

title: very nice view of Taj
review: the mehtab bagh is very nice and calm place to view Taj from different angle, the place is very relaxing when less crowded, tips for tourist dont miss the chance to have stunning view of Taj from mehtab bagh

title: Relaxed
review: My friends & I enjoyed being in Mehta Bagh. It is a beautiful well maontained garden. It was awesome to see the Taj Mahal from this garden. It was a lovely evening sitting & just admiring the Taj Mahal.

title: Worth visiting after the Taj Mahal
review: The gardens of Mehtab Bagh are nothing exceptional.  it is, however, worth visiting here for a view south across the river to the Taj Mahal after visiting the latter.  You'll enjoy a pleasant, different, view of the Taj.  I spent approximately 30 minutes here at mid-afternoon and enjoyed it.  It would be especially lovely at sunrise or sunset.

title: Insect repellant
review: Beautiful views of the Taj that make for excellent pictures. no major crowds even in late afternoon/early evening. Tons of bugs/mosquitos though, so wear long pants/sleeves and/or lather yourself up in insect repellant.

title: Backside view of Taj
review: Only place to have unobstructed view of TAJ from the other side of Yamuna River and the best time is sunset...If the sky is clear, it is ethereal

title: Great view of the Taj, but expensive.
review: Beautiful sunset views of the Taj, without the hordes of people. However it costs 200 rupees to get inside what is essentially a field with some trees. Would pay again.

title: The Moon Gardens are a great way to warm-up for the Taj visit!
review: We had some spare time the day before were to visit the Taj and came here.

title: Very rare nice and beautifull garden for tourist visiting here you can see whole tajmhal this is very big garden
review: Mehtab buag is the very big garden for visiters. Shahjahan was also mading second tajmahal.but his son auragzeb stoped him and stoped structure is called today mehtab baug. Nice place should visit during evening time 5 pm to 7 pm sunset point

title: Rear of Taj Mahal
review: We visited the Mehtab Bagh in late afternoon when the sun was setting. The moonlight garden was an extension of the Taj Mahal Garden but on opposite side of river. It was lost under mud but excavated in the 1990's - the octagonal pool and pavilion are in good condition. There is a cremation area on the opposite bank to the right.

title: Great view for sunset (if there is one)
review: Nowhere near as crowded as Taj Mahal, great place view the tomb in all is glory. When we were in Agra it was often hazy later in the day so sunset may not be spectacular but this is a nice peaceful spot; sunrise might be better if this garden is open. Security guard shooing us out at the end was very nice and patient when we asked for time for another pic.

title: Needs care
review: This is a garden situated on opposite side of Taj Mahal on the bank of Yamuna river.. Needs huge development work for this one

title: Mehtab Bagh - an excuse for a garden
review: Much hyped online, the Mehatb Bagh was a disappointment when I visited it on 2 Oct 2016. 'Bagh' means 'garden' in Hindi and there was a 'garden' but not well maintained. The shrubs were almost dried up (terrible for Oct) and the pathways dusty and unkempt. The hype was to visit this garden for a rear view of the Taj from across the River Yamuna. The view was good, but not worth the trouble of the round about, half hour journey.

title: Yes we walked there and it was still amazing seeing Taj in the distance.
review: The Taj Mahaal was built for the third and favourite wife.  Her surname was Mahaal and I did not realise this til I visited.

title: Must do
review: I'm a little sorry that we saw this view first since we arrived in Agra early evening. It sort of ruined it for us.  But highly recommend this as a second view of the Taj.

title: Beautiful Mehtab Bagh.
review: A visit to the beautiful Mehtab Bagh gardens in Agra is a must. The Garden complex is situated on the opposite bank of the Taj Mahal, is known as Mehtab Bagh, or “The Moonlight Garden”. I went there for the first time this year. WE went there soon before sunset. Got a good distant view of Taj as the day was clear with no haze. The garden is well maintained. Overall Good

title: Good to go before actually getting to the Taj
review: It's always good to view things from different perspectives – same for the Taj Mahal! The Mehtab Bagh was quiet, serene and a lovely place to have long conversations and simply enjoy the company you're with, while basking in the view of the Taj from across the river. I would strongly recommend going to this park on top of the actual visit to Taj Mahal.

title: a must see view of the Taj Mahal
review: I had read that you should see the Taj Mahal from the other side and I am so pleased that we did.  The views are breathtaking.

title: Very nice
review: Very nice visit and worth the time to walk around the Taj and seeing all the site has to offer, must do

title: optima travels thanks a lot
review: Anshumali Tiwari and all  his staff thanks a lot......for our incredible trip the golden triangle trip was awesome   .....

title: Go for the views of the Taj
review: The gardens are nice, and so is the river. But the main reason to visit is for the unobstructed (by people!) views of the Taj. Best visited in the afternoon - the lighting conditions are best at that time.

title: What a view
review: Wow what a view of Taj Mahal in the evening across the river. It is said shahjahan planned black marble Taj Mahal at this site but knowing about father's plan for black Taj Mahal his son put him in house arrest.

title: Best during evenings
review: To have another view of the Taj Mahal, it's great to visit this place around sunset.

title: Views of the Taj...
review: Well, the 'Moon Gardens' are on the opposite side of the river to the Taj Mahal and popular at sunset. The gardens themselves are okay , but the riverside - facing the Taj- is tatty and fenced off with barbed wire, with uneven banks and ditches. The sunset was nothing special on the night we went, perhaps it's a better visit if the sunset is spectacular.

title: Perfect With Of The Taj, Without The Crowd
review: Mehtab Bagh translates into Moonlight Garden.

title: Ok, but its enough going to Taj.
review: For me it was nice to see, but in my opinion its enough to go inside the Taj. You have to pay a fee only for seeing the Taj in another perspective. Sunset wasn't special (maybe because of the clouds).

title: Just the view of the Taj
review: This was our second spot of the day, and we skipped going in, I don't find it worth the fee, as we were told that you only get the back view of the Taj Mahal and just the foundations of the Black Taj, which Emperor Shahjahan was building for himself. And since I was with some foreigners, i find the fee for the garden is to be too high, we are just travelled around and went to the Buddha temple, we had a nice chat with the monks there, and then we went around the temple and saw the view of the Taj Mahal from there, I agree it's not directly opposite but it is worth it, and there were armed forces, who are nice and helpful, they let us go till the last point and click few pics. If all the members of the group are Indian, it could be worth going in. otherwise just go around the Buddha Temple and enjoy the view.

title: Best  Place for couple Shoot  in Agra
review: should visit for  shoots , beautiful flower, lush green gardens,  To experience the beauty of taj with yamuna river

title: Amazing#twilight#remarkable sight
review: No words for this place

title: Nice view of Taj
review: Mehtab Bagh is about 12km from Taj Mahal and the garden itself is beautiful. The view from the garden overlooking the Taj and Yamuna river is gorgeous.

title: Great View from another side
review: This venue offers amazing view of

title: A beautiful, relatively unknown place. Best view of Taj.
review: This surely has to be among the top spots to visit if you're in Agra, the view of Taj and the flora is captivating! This is both, a photographers and a nature lovers delight. After many visits to Agra, visited this place for the first time in this trip, and this was the highlight among all the attractions.

title: Ok Attraction to Visit
review: Worth a short visit only. Supposed to be site for Black Taj as shadow image for while marble Taj. The foundation was hardly completed so there is nothing there. The only reason to be there is so one can get great view of Taj from behind. But the view is only worth in late afternoon only when Sun is behind one's back. In morning the view is hazy and does not allow good backdrop for pictures due to Sun position. However there are no crowds so one can get a decent picture with Taj backdrop with no one around you. However not a must visit.

title: Ideal place to click pictures of the taj from across the Yamuna river..
review: Methab Baugh by itself doesn't excite at all. Bit during sunrise and especially at sunset, it's an ideal spot to click pictures of the taj from across river Yamuna at leisure

title: Best unobstructed view with a non hassled approach due to lack of vendors
review: Definitely worth a visit in the afternoon to get the best possible lighting for photos. Garden is a good area to roam around/play with your kids and enjoy the marvel called Taj again.

title: Stunning view
review: We visited these gardens in the early evening and the view of the Taj Mahal from here is surreal. The photos we got here are better than at the Taj itself as there were less people. If you are not travelling with a guide watch where they take photos from as they really know there stuff. We could have sat here watching the sunset forever as the Taj changes colour and a peacefulness descends! There was an opportunity for a camel ride here but we didn't do that. Water is cheap to buy at the little kiosks. We had booked through Imagine India and the service and value for money seems impossible!!! Highly recommended.

title: Best view of Taj Mahal from a great garden
review: Arguably best view of Taj Mahal around sunset from this garden. River Yamuna flows between Taj Mahal and Mehtab Bagh.

title: best view of tajmahal from mehtab bagh.
review: This is also a famous garden from the mughal period. This garden is on the opposite side of taj mahal. This garden is very beautiful with trees and flowers.Its opens from sunrise to sunset and lot of tourist prefer to take the good photos of tajmahal from garden.The view of taj mahal from this garden is very beautiful .On Friday Taj mahal is closed  and tourist visits this garden to take the pictures.This garden is  the one of the best location to shoot the movies and lots of movies and documentaries have been shooted  in this garden.

title: Perfect spot for Sunset in Agra
review: One can have the best view of Taj Mahal from Mehtab Bagh.

title: Beautiful evening at Bagh
review: Amazing weather and beautiful view of Taj Mahal from the back, made our evening. it is open from Sunrise to Sunset and a ticket needs to be purchased. it was not as crowded as Taj Mahal.

title: Agra walks
review: We ended our Agra walk at Mehta Agba. A wonderfull view at the back of the Taj. As the front is now under construction, the back is now even More beautiful. You can take great pictures with the river in front of the Taj.

title: Great view
review: This garden offers great view of Taj Mahal and is a very good garden as it is very very green and also has the  quarter made taj situated.

title: Simply Beautiful !!!
review: It's an Wow place to be there and spent time with your loved one...The Taj is just next to you...perfect place for memorable clicks...recommended to visit in evenings!!!

title: Sun Set View of Taj
review: The gardens are an excellent place to view the Taj Mahal in the comfort of lovely gardens. The Mehtab Bagh was constructed by Shah Jahan so he could view the Taj in relative peace in beautiful surrounds and you can too.

title: Black Taj Mahal Site Different Angle to see the White Taj mahal from Mehtab Bagh
review: Hello its nice to see the Taj Mahal from other side of river Yamuna Great view of the Taj comes from this side

title: Don't miss it...
review: Take visit in afternoon time... You can rest & get freshness , you can see a back side of taj mahal view very closely & clearly...

title: Romantic evening at its best.
review: Went here as our final stop of the day. It was evening time and people watching the sunset. 200inr to enter. Nice gardens and trees to slowly take in the atmosphere and taj. This is a must at an evening time.

title: Taj Mahal views
review: We went in the morning and got stunning views of the TM. The only problem was the humidity, that kept clouding the lens of my Nikon 3100. The iPhone did better. Pix attached.

title: Best views of the Taj
review: The Taj is massively crowded and it can be difficult to find the time to pause and review the majesty of the place. Not here. There is plenty of time to soak up the fantastic views of the place especially as it is difficult to see the back of the Taj from the Taj itself as there is little space on the site as it is constricted by the river.  Really highly recommended.

title: Very nice view of Taj Mahal
review: Its a park with some flowers. Nothing special but the park have amazing view of Taj Mahal. 200 INR to get in.

title: Truelly The Best views of the Taj”
review: The Mehtab Bagh garden was the last of eleven Mughal-built gardens along the Yamuna opposite the Taj Mahal and the Agra Fortthe first being Ram Bagh It is mentioned that this garden was built by Emperor Babur It is also noted that Emperor Shah Jahan had identified a site from the crescent-shaped, grass-covered floodplain across the Yamuna River as an ideal location for viewing the Taj Mahal. It was then created as "a moonlit pleasure garden called Mehtab Bagh." White plaster walkways, airy pavilions, pools and fountains were also created as part of the garden, with fruit trees and narcissus.The garden was designed as an integral part of the Taj Mahal complex in the riverfront terrace pattern. Its width was identical to that of the rest of the Taj Mahal.

title: Taj Views sans the crowd!
review: Even though its not a "garden" garden more of looked like garden ruins to me.They have planted lot of trees in the middle of the garden but very few places to sit. but this is an excellent place to admire the beauty of Taj with peace of mind intact. It is here that we were able to take all the pics without being pushed around by the crowd. you can sit quietly and look at Taj for as much time you would want to. When we went there were hardly 10-15 people except us. and we were able to soak up the "Taj" feeling to the fullest here.

title: Clear view of the Taj
review: It was developed as a moonlight pleasure garden later known as Mehtab Bagh. The terrace pattern of the garden is so amazing that you would fall in love with it. The Taj Mahal was itself crowded, but from here you would get plenty of time to soak up the beauty of the Taj. Frankly speaking about the garden, it is more like the ruins of a property. It is on the banks of river Yamuna which used to flow from here.

title: Could be beautiful but needs improvement
review: Yes the place offers fantastic views of the Taj, but can be better maintained. There was a ditch and it had been marked with a warning board, not too secure. I found it ordinary, lacks proper paths and signage. Could be better if improved.

title: Don't go expecting a sunset picture.
review: We went here because we were told we could get a sunset picture of Taj Mahal. The truth is that the Taj and this garden are north and southe facing, so no sunset picture was to be had.
