In fact as soon as the sun sets the garden closes, so even if the sky were to be reds or pinks, you would be out of the garden before you could get a picture.

title: It's good for there local couple hahaha..!!
review: As I expect I will see there good or something different but I seen there only local couple sit behind tree and doing **** so don't go there if you want save money and time.

title: A beautiful view of the Taj Mahal
review: The park is where a second Mausoleum in black was planned. It never got finished, as the mogul was imprisoned by his son. Probably because he wanted to stop him spending more money. The Park is not really nicely held in order. But the view is great.

title: Interesting and much less crowded view of Taj
review: This was a nice and much less crowded view of Taj.  The gardens are ok but not spectacular.  Also, it had just stopped raining so it was extremely hot and humid but that helped keep the bugs down.

title: greenery
review: this greenery makes Taj more beautiful.It is well watered and can walk around it and feel the nature.

title: Great view of Taj & Interesting Archeology too
review: Understandably, the Taj is packed with people.  I even made it to the Taj when it opened, and after a short time, it was impossible to get any peace while appreciating the incomparable structure.  That is the first reason why Mehtab Bagh is great.  Although it is from a distance, the views of the Taj are excellent, and you likely won’t find many people at your elbow.  The second reason for me that Mehtab Bagh was an excellent visit was an archeological excavation pit along what was a wall of the earlier site.  It went down probably about 20-25 feet to the top of an arch.  That leads me to believe that the wall went a good ways below the 20-25 feet, and increases my curiosity of what is below the other structures visible at the site.  I don’t know how long ago the pit was dug, but it looks like it was quite a while ago.  Now-a-days there is a flock of very pretty birds that live in the pit.  The gardens at Mehtab Bagh are an added bonus, though I won’t consider them outstanding by any means.

title: Well kept gardens
review: The gardens are well maintained. they do not allow people to go in. People are allowed only in restricted areas. The Taj looks beautiful with the gardens in the foreground.

title: Beautiful side view of the Taj Mahal
review: This is surely a must visit place in Agra.

title: Visit for Tajmahal view
review: Mehtab Bagh is located opposite to tajmahal...and view of Taj or really beautiful from mehtab bagh. Ag taj mahal you will find crowd and time limit but here you will be at a peaceful and beautiful place.

title: Great Way to see the Taj without the lines
review: This is were the black marble version of the Majal was supposed to be built but was never completed.   If you want to skip the lines and see the Taj from a different view this is the place to go.

title: Must see for an alternate view of the Taj
review: Not included in normal tourist attractions as everyone wants to cover Agra in a day, while 2-3 days is ideal to enjoy all tourist attractions in Agra.

title: Average garden!!
review: Went to mehtab bagh and was bit disappointed as it was not the typical garden one expects. It was not much maintained nor it has very good flower collection. The only positive point is that it is just near to tajmahal hence one gets a good view of it

title: Very peacefull
review: Lovely place to visit and relax for a while when the weather is cooler. Uninterrupted view of the rear of the Taj Mahal for photos. Wasn't overly busy. Don't cross the fence as there are water buffelos in the water.

title: Nice Park
review: Very nice place for see the sunset point and sunrise point I am see both of us what a wonderful look sunrise time for Taj Mahal it's beautiful look on sunrise time

title: Backside of Taj Mahal
review: You can just skip this place if you're visiting Taj Mahal. More likely couples stay here. Just watch sunrise or sunset when you're in Taj Mahal. But if you don't mind spending few rupees then visit the place.

title: Better than Taj Itself
review: If you like the concept of beauty in entirety, then this is the place to be.

title: best view of taj in the eve
review: Best place to view taj during sunset from mehtab bagh. Be there around 4.30 to get the different shades of sunlight beaming on the taj. Most visited by foreigners. Some police question the tripod to be not allowed in there.

title: Good to visit if you wish to see Taj from a cross the river
review: Only visit this place if you wish to visit taj from far away and in a peace full atmosphere

title: Lovely place to view Taj Mahal
review: We were advised by our Hotel Chef to visit Mehtab Bagh and this turned out to be a great advise. This place is ideally located across the river and offers a great place to view the Taj Mahal.

title: Unique view of Taj
review: Unexplored and unique view of Taj through the well kept garden. Was well worth the drive to the other side of Taj.

title: Awesome place to relax n enjoy the View of Taj Mahal
review: You can enjoy the View of Taj Mahal from here with very minimal crowd. Plan your visit in the early hours (morning) or by 5pm in the evening. If you are a photographer, then this is the location for you.

title: N
review: I did not enjoy going to mehatabagh it is quite far and deserted .it was as good as I thought .there was not much to do and it is not as popular as taj Mahal or lal quila .it is in the remote corner of Agra.

title: Average place with good views
review: These gardens are very mediocre. Not professionally maintained. However, the views of Taj are good and if you are there you might as well visit it.

title: Less frequented area, But worth visiting, away from the crowd @ Taj
review: We were very glad to have visited this place. There were hardly 5-6 people at the garden. The view of the Taj is as beautiul from this side. Got some good photo ops along with this garden and flowers in background.

title: Enjoy from here for Sunrise/set
review: Located at Yamuna Banks, straight opposite to Taj. Not lucky enough to capture Taj with reflection as the rived dried out and was more of a grass land. Plan to visit at sunrise or sunset to get unimaginable perspective of Taj.

title: Beautiful
review: This is a well maintained, gorgeous garden which is opposite the Taj Mahal across the river. The serenity of the park is nearly unmatched, especially in the bustling town of Agra.

title: Just a grass viewpoint of Taj Mahal
review: Another rip off. Charged 200 rupees per person to walk on some grass, batting away mosquitos and flies to get a view of the Taj Mahal at sunset.

title: The Mehtab Bagh in Agra
review: We visited the Mehtab Bagh in Agra during may this year. The Bagh is located just behind the Taj and is, in fact, clearly visible from the Taj. It's clean & green but that's about it. You won't lose much if you don't visit it separately.

title: Good... if you have time !
review: If you have spare time go in the evening. If the river is properly filled with water, then you can take good clicks of the Taj with its reflection in the water. But thesedays the river is almost dried out, so no point.

title: Go for the sunrise!
review: It is beautiful to go for the sunrise. It is not very hot and you can hear locals pray. Really glad we got to experience it.

title: Couple place
review: This is totally couple place. But also as family place for tour. Placed on just behind taj mahal. Look like simple garden where you spend some time after taj mahal

title: Nice peace of greenery - not more
review: In the hot Indian climate every park is highly appreciated, especially in an industrial city like Agra.

title: Beautiful!
review: I recommend Mehtab Bagh!  Great picturesque views of the Taj Mahal.  I recommend going to the garden at dusk for the best pictures.

title: This place was AMAZING!
review: Mehtab Bagh, Was beautiful! the view of the Taj was breathtaking! not to mention the real authentic surrounding, local people washing their clothing and bathing in the river! this place is a much.

title: Must see
review: You must see the Taj from this angle. It is more peaceful and just as beautiful, especially with the river too.

title: Different view of Taj Mahal.
review: This small garden area is very simple and not particularly pretty or well kept. The positive slant on this area is that it is at the side of the river which runs along the back of the Taj Mahal. It is a very quiet spot and allows visitors to have a more serene view of the iconic building without the crowds. Admittedly it is the back view but it still highlights the beauty and grandeur of this World Heritage attraction, without the crowds.

title: Serene and green
review: If a really calm and unrushed view of the Taj is what you would like, head to Mehtab Bagh. Eatables is not allowed inside the garden

title: The other facet of Taj Mahal
review: Again a wonderful experience. Watching Taj Mahal from the other side of the river. Thanks to Rizwan.

title: Happily give it a miss
review: Not too much to see here. Spend your time doing other things such as Agra Fort and Fatipur Sikri instead.

title: Back side of Taj
review: That's another adventure after you have viewed Taj from close. If you wish to see Taj from its back yard then you will have to come here. This site opposite river Yamuna and you can stand on site where Black Taj was supposed to be built. The approach to this site however is horrible. You will get introduced to worst UP has to offer. But its worth a visit at least once in lifetime.

title: See the taj from a distance
review: It's basically a garden opposite from where you can see the back of Taj Mahal. The gardens are quite okayly maintained. However during my visit, there were some areas that were left not maintained.

title: Well maintained bagh with beautiful flowers
review: Mehtab Bagh is situated close to Taj Mahal. Make sure you visit it in the evening as the afternoon is very hot. A well maintained bagh with beautiful and serene flowers.

title: Romantic place for sun set.
review: This place might be the best spot for the sun set in Agra. It is located on the other side of the river which in the dry season you can see cows and shepherds walking in its channel and in the rainy season has a lot of water.

title: personal
review: For those of you that wish to have a more personal experience of this great monument head here.Make sure you have a reasonable telephoto or zoom lens and I dont think you can bet the photo shots.This place is situated across the river from the Taj and is a perfect place at sunset. Peaceful gardens with no crowds. We found that after visiting the Taaj at dawn we much prefered the peace and tranquility of the sunset view. Make it special if you can get a bottle of wine and grab a bench under a tree facing the Taj at sunset as we did it was heaven. Try it but allow time to relax and soak up the view

title: Cool and Calm place in Agra
review: Amazing sunset views of the Taj Mahal. Walk through the trees and greenery, small ramparts and nice place to have Photos with Taj Mahal...

title: Best view of taj. Thats it
review: Here u get best views of taj. Thats it. So called garden is shabby n boring.

title: Unknown Taj Mahal
review: We visited here on the Friday evening as the Taj Mahal isn't open on Fridays. The views are of the rear over the Yamuna River and offer spectacular sunset views, if you're fortunate enough to have clear skies, as did. Less crowded, not many tourists, mostly locals and stunning views of the rear of the Taj Mahal - and the Mehtab Bagh Gardens - Highly Recommended.

title: gardens over the yamuna river
review: Not really that impressed TBH, was taken by my guide who told me the foundations on site were for a back marble tomb, only for there to be no black marble!! gardens pleasant enough, good photo opportunity of taj from over the river

title: Spot with a beautiful view of the Taj from the River Side
review: There is a beautiful view of the Taj Mahal but the gardens themselves need clean up and fix up....You would only come here for the view of the Taj.

title: Too hot
review: Its just a park with close view of taj across the yamuna river

title: A bit dissapointing
review: I think it was ok but the least favourite of the things I saw. Interesting seeing where black taj would have been but learn nothing new really. Not too expensive to nip in though.

title: Great photo of taj mahal from mehtab bagh
review: Mehtab bagh is located trans yamuna river behind of taj mahal. very quit place. great view of taj  mahal in sun rise time.

title: Good view of Taj
review: This Park gives really good view of Taj from back, but this place has not much parking, So, during busy seasons it can be problem.

title: A lovely place to visit
review: To view the TAJ from a different angle, you must visit this place. You may view the TAJ in full and take good snaps.

title: Expensive photo opportunity
review: These gardens are, apparently, being restored but they were just full of litter and it really is a money making exercise to give tourists another photo opportunity of the Taj from across the river.  It wasn't worth it but while we were 'doing Agra', we went along with it!

title: Different view of the Taj
review: Go here at sunset for a different view of the Taj. You are a little further away and get some good photos and different perspective from across the river

title: Pretty place to view the Taj Mahal in the evening
review: It is a garden which overlooks the backside of the Taj Mahal. It is actually the site where ShahJahan planned to build a 'black' Taj Mahal for himself. He was placed under house arrest by his son before he could finish it.

title: Wow!
review: If you are looking for a different view of the Taj Mahal, while enjoying great amounts of flora - look no further!  Well worth your time to walk in garden with one of the best views of the Taj Mahal you can imagine.

title: behind Taj ,across Yamuna river, good place to take photo during evenings
review: Big garden behind Taj, across Yamuna river,  Ideal to watch Taj at sunset . But sunset is not always colourful and may be cloudy. Also Guards start sending visitors out of the park a bit sooner than actual sunset completion, since there is no proper lighting once it gets dark. May be one can get Taj photo with water reflections in rainy season when Yamuna river is full.

title: Mehtab Bagh at Dawn
review: It was 24th April. Me and my wife started from my home in Ghaziabad at around 1am around mid-night and took the Yamuna expressway to reach Agra by 5am in the morning. We were at the gate of Mehtab Bagh by 5:30am. It opened at 5:45 and we were the first one that morning to enter.

title: “Best photo location for the Taj Mahal”
review: When you visit agra you must go to metab bagh try a different look of Taj. Nice backside view of the Taj Mahal across the river.This garden is the place where Shah Jahan's incomplete black Taj.

title: Spectacular
review: It is good place to visit on a bright sunny day. Quite well maintained. But if u have few days to visit Agra, maybe 2 or 3 then this place can be skipped. There are many more beautiful monuments that should be kept as the first priority.

title: Great view but that's pretty much it
review: They've hiked the prices here, as well as at all the other sights in Agra, so this now costs 200 Rs to get in.  The "gardens" are pretty shabby to be honest. The fountain doesn't look like it's seen water in decades.  You come here for a view of the Taj Mahal across the river, and for that it's worthwhile.  I'd suggest coming on a Friday when the Taj itself is actually closed.

title: What a view of Taj
review: While every one gets to see the Taj from its usual side, one has to experience the view of the Taj from Mehtab Bagh. Amazing view of the Taj from here, and when we went there in December 2015, we got a private view of Taj, as there was no one else!

title: Best photo location for the Taj Mahal
review: The Taj Mahal itself is always flooded with people traveling from the far ends of the earth to visit the most photographed building in the world. However if you want great photos, without the crowds of people in the background, visit the Mehtab Bagh (which is technically garden the front of the Taj Mahal)

title: Great Stop For Photographers
review: Overview: A simple garden with a rewarding view of the Taj Mahal. I suggest visiting closer to dusk.

title: peaceful way to enjoy taj
review: we came here just before sunset (it is closed after sunset) and spent a great few hours lying on the grass and wandering around taking photos. is really a great view of the taj from here.

title: Not a must visit
review: It is very far from Taj. Lot of walking. Parking is available. But not many flowers. Only good view of Taj. Nothing else.

title: Definitely worth a stop on your visit to Agra!
review: Glad my tour guide suggested this one! Quieter than Taj Mahal and Agra Fort, at least in April. I fell in love with the inlaid marble and Mughal art, so really enjoyed this structure where one can stroll around it, having a closer look. Also photography is allowed inside, unlike Taj.

title: A must visit !!
review: This place offers a spectacular, unhindered view of Taj Mahal which is otherwise rare in the Taj premises. The garden is quite, serene and watching the sunset gives a sense of tranquility. A must visit place :)

title: Great Views =P
review: If you get a chance its good to catch a tuktuk to this spot. you have to pay to get in which is a shame...

title: Great from Mehtab bagh too....
review: Our tour guide took us to have a glimpse of Taj from Mehtab bagh where Shah Jehan was planning to built another Taj Mahal by black marble as shadow of Taj Mahal, couple not completed as he was imprisoned by his own son.

title: Great for sunset
review: Take your time and enjoy the gardens then watch the sunset.  After the monsoon with the river high it is incredible.

title: Best evening spot...
review: Mehtab Bagh or The Moon Garden is the spot to enjoy the Taj Mahal from the other side of Yamuna. It is best to visit this place in the evening and what you get is a crowd-less view of the Taj.

title: Hmmm...
review: Nice backside view of the Taj Mahal across the river. My friend and I went here expecting to capture a beautiful sunset but were disappointed. Perhaps its the time of year but the sun set alongside the Taj, not anywhere close enough to create all those spectacular photos we've seen online. The gardens were also not in bloom; in bloom I bet it'd be beautiful!

title: First Glimpse
review: Our first glimpse of the Taj Mahal was in the late afternoon from Mehtab Bagh. It was well worth spending time in the gardens.

title: Fascinating
review: Moguls are known for their magnificent architecture  & beautiful gardens to go with it. Mehtab Bagh are one of them. The beautiful view Taj Mahal across the Holy Yamuna river can be seen frm this very place. This garden is the place where Shah Jahan's incomplete black Taj lies. One get to see the unfinished structure of the black Taj here. Beautiful garden with fascinating view of Taj & Shah Jahan's dream

title: Worth visit
review: Yes the gardens are not exceptional but the views are especially if you want the full Taj experience and some great photo opportunities.

title: Mind blowing view of taj mahal
review: When you visit agra you must go to metab bagh try a different look offtaj a peaceful taj maximum number off 50 to 100 visitors you found this side and mehtab bagh also a great place for birding lots off beautiful birds are present here because off yomuna river and also a nice garden beautiful place for photography.

title: Should Visit!!
review: It's a waste if you visited the Taj Mahal and didn't come here! It'll be a good site to take a complete picture of Taj Mahal. The view is so good! Furthermore this is the site that Shah Jahan wanted to build another Mahal... :)

title: great TM view
review: this place need to be visited just to get a wonderful view of the Taj especially under the reflection of river Yamuna. You need to have a vehcle in order to access Mehtab Bagh. It takes about 30 min in the peak Agra traffic to reach from 'downtown' Agra to this place. However due to restrictions by ASI, one is not supposed to take in any food material inside the garden.

title: Do not miss this view!!!
review: I've been to the Taj several times but this is the first time to Mehtab Bagh. there is nothing worth mentioning about the park though you can call it well maintained by Indian standards.

title: Amzing view of Taj Mahal from here
review: Explored the sunset of view Of Taj Mahal from here and it was really amazing, never experienced the sunset like this...

title: Good for a view with a difference
review: We called in for a look, after visiting The Itmad-Ud-Dullah, late in the afternoon. Interesting to stand on the site where Shah Jahan had dreams of building his tomb matching that of Mumtaz, but in black marble. For an Indian garden area, it's not bad, neat well kept rows of trees, not huge crowds, make it a pleasant restful place. Good place to photograph The Taj. But next time I would go in the morning when the sun light would be more behind the photographer.

title: Calm relaxing park but nothing more
review: Mehtab Bagh was the last stop on our organised guided tour of the Agra Fort, Baby Taj and here.

title: Taj - a different viewing point and Bedai at Deviram Sweets
review: Visited earlier this month as part of a foodie trip to Agra. Our first stop was Deviram Sweets at Pratap Pura for Bedai and Jalebi. Few pictures of Bedai and Deviram Sweets.

title: Nice view of the Taj at sunset.
review: This gives you a nice view of the Taj Mahal from the other side of the river.  The gardens are nice and it offers a little more peace than actually going into the Taj, although we did both.

title: serenity amidst lot of noise and loud.
review: serenity amidst lot of noise and loud. very well maintained gardens, but still it can be made lot better

title: Make sure you arrive before sunset.
review: You are standing on the riverbank as you view the surrounding flora and fauna.  There is always a crowd of buses and taxis.

title: Lots of mosquitos; ok view of Taj Mahal
review: We went to this park in the evening for the sunset viewing of the Taj Mahal.  While waiting for sunset, we walked around in the park and noticed lots of mosquitos; we were glad we had on insect repellent. Sunset thru the air pollution turned the western sky red, but the Taj Mahal stayed white (we were expecting it to turn red) -- we were disappointed.  Due to this, we decided to skip the sun rise viewing the next morning.

title: Perfect place to watch the sunrise across the river
review: We visited the gardens to watch the sunrise in February 2016.

title: Peaceful introduction to Taj Mahal
review: Following the advice of others we went here for a sunset first view of the Taj Mahal. It was very peaceful wandering through the garden to the end where we could see the Taj Mahal across the river. We could also see the crowds across there and were glad to be seeing it on our side with less people, to have time to take in its size & beauty. Although it was too cloudy to really see a sunset it was still worthwhile. I also recommend walking up to the corner to see the old red watchtower. Only 100 Rp each to enter garden.

title: A disappointing place.
review: I had read about the view of the Taj Mahal from across the river - it would be stunning.  Our driver and guide took us to Mentab Baghdad and suggested that if we wanted to see the Taj from this side, rather than pay to walk through these gardens, just walk down the road to the side and we would get some great views.  It was disappointing as we couldn't access right down to the river and also the river was so low that photos would have been rather a let down anyway.

title: Good place
review: It's an informal garden which reatins the historical tinge of landscaping. Nothing much to do but still worth a visit.

title: just average place
review: You can view Taj from this place. Beautiful gardens and good place to relax

title: Hood view, but nothing more
review: Spent here half an hour in the evening to see the sunset light playing with the facade. It is nice, but not sure worth visiting after you've been to the Taj itself.

title: Good view
review: Peaceful place of back view in Taj mahal. We can see yamuna river and also fort.Nothing much architect is awesome with full of white marbles and natural scenario. In full moon day it will look good for eyes too.

title: A peaceful spot to stare at the beautiful Taj
review: A peaceful spot to stare at the beautiful Taj at sunset, but you will be kicked out by the guards just as the sun is going down. It was great to just sit there and relax and take in the majestic building across the river. Surrounded by gardens and tourists, get your spot on the wall and just relax!

title: Agra Trip : New Discover
review: This is a Photographers Paradise. If you can plan your trip on Friday Evening u can get to take a picture of Tajmahal without crowd. Not sure why Tripod is not allowed here. Many Birds and Flower nicely maintained park. Here located Black Tajmahal Foundation. One can cover Baby Tajmahal which situated in the same route.

title: A different view of the Taj Mahal
review: The Mehtab Bagh was a very important Moghul garden which is now in the course of being restored.  There is not a lot to see in the garden itself but it offers a great view of the Taj Mahal from the opposite side of the river.  The ideal is to go to the Taj for sunrise and the garden for sunset.  It combines easliy with visiting Itamad- ud- Daula's tomb.

title: Enjoy the sunset view of the Taj Mahal
review: This place across the river from the Taj Mahal is the ideal place to enjoy the sunset.

title: Back view of the Taj
review: Excellent view of the backside of the Taj Mahal. This is where the king was supposed to build the Black Taj Mahal in honor of himself, however he was put in captivity by his son so he could not start the project. You can get excellent pictures of the Taj Mahal from here.

title: Nice park with a great northern view of the Taj Mahal
review: Worth a one hour visit to walk and relax on a hot day

title: A Quiet Retreat in Agra with Uniconic View of Taj Mahal
review: Mehtab Bagh today is a beautiful park along the banks of the Yamuna River, across from the Taj Mahal. It offers respite and a place to walk quietly, contemplate, and view the Taj from the rear. There are some unrestored features, such as a lotus pool and an enclosure wall, with guard towers along the riverbank. Archaeological excavations suggest that careful examination of these monuments is underway. There are a few trees offering shade, some park benches, and lots of greenery and flower beds.

title: nice view
review: The garden itself is not worth visiting but the view on the Taj is really worth it. Check if there are no clouds the evening of your visit for the best view and pics.

title: Best place to see the Taj at sunset
review: The title pretty much says it all.  I've been here a couple times.  The gardens themselves aren't that impressive, but the view across the river is!  Under the right conditions this is the best place to see the colors of the Taj at sunset.  It is also a nice place to chat with folks from all over the world as you watch the show.

title: No Sunset
review: Were taken here as part of an extra excursion on the Kuoni Taj tour. The park is quite boring - mainly trees and grass. The signs with rules are quite funny though. We stood for about an hour to see the sunset. There is a good view of the Taj across the river but the sun set quite away from it and did not affect the Taj at all. We did see birds and could also see burning at the cremation site not far away.

title: Back view of the Taj Mahal
review: The gardens are not particularly impressive, but if it isn't too hazy, Mehtab Bagh does afford a beautiful sunset view of the Taj Mahal across the Yamuna River.  Not many people and a peaceful, quiet view of this beautiful monument.

title: Peaceful vistas of the Taj Mahal
review: Across the Yamuna River from the Taj Mahal are the Moonlight Gardens: Mehtab Bagh: the ultimate Taj Mahal viewing spot: a peaceful, uninteresting park with wonderful photographic opportunities of the Taj. The Mughal Garden was built to the identical width of the Taj Mahal complex and is exactly aligned with the marble mausoleum. Getting there however involves crossing the city of Agra on poor roads with traffic jams and incessant hooters/horns...

title: Nice romantic park
review: Mehtab bagh is located on back of taj mahal on bank of yamuna river.

title: Go for a totally new view of The Taj
review: It is exactly in the back of the Taj Mahal. Before you enter Agra, you can actually visit this Mehtab Bagh or you may also opt to visit this place while leaving the city. Spend some time at this Bagh and view the Taj from this place. You will love this view.

title: AN EXCELLENT FIRST VIEWING POINT FOR THE TAJ MAHAL
review: Perhaps the best place for first seeing the Taj Mahal. The view from a park on the other side of the Yamuna River is stunning, the setting is peaceful and it makes a subsequent visit to the Taj all the more enjoyable. If you can be there as the sun goes down, you’ll be rewarded with some spectacular views. The park is 8km distant and 20 minutes drive from the Taj Mahal.

title: Lovely garden
review: The Mehtab Bagh is a rather peaceful spot to spend an afternoon in. Beautiful flowers, trees, and shrubs, along with small pools of water are scattered throughout the garden. One can walk to the edge of the garden and find some rather interesting views across the river, of the Taj Mahal. July 2012.

title: Beautiful place to me
review: With the beautiful view of the Tajmahal, this place can be an ideal setting for pictures to take back home as a memory of your visit to Agra. With open spaces, go there at sunset to let your kids enjoy the most.

title: sand model of taj mahal
review: this is other side of river yamuna, one can see beauty of  taj mahal in the sunrise from here. it takes time to reach this beautiful place.witout seeing tajmahal from this garden ,visiting taj is incomplete.

title: A different perspective of Taj.
review: Its opposite the Taj Mahal across the Yamuna. Nice place to see the Taj at sunset. A lot of foreign tourists go there.

title: Interesting perspective of the breathtaking Taj Mahal
review: Across the river from the Taj Mahal is Mehtab Bagh, a park where you can see the foundation of what would have been the black marble Taj of Shah Jahan. With its gardens and views of the Taj Mahal, it's a lovely place to stroll and take photographs. There are also much smaller crowds.

title: great view of taj
review: if you want to avoid the crowds, go to mehtab bagh. a lesser visited place for a better view of taj. the garden in itself isnt that great , but if you are here to click pictures, you can actually get pictures of just taj without the crowd

title: Average garden not much different
review: We went to mehtab bagh in the afternoon as it was on the way to our hotel. However the only thing is one can get the view of tajmahal at sone distance however apart from that it is just an average garden with not much to spend time. We stayed for approx an hour and left after some photo clicks.

title: A potential tourist place transforming to ruins
review: This is one of those mysterious places in the history of Agra.

title: Interesting view
review: The Taj stands dreamily at the edge of the undulating maidan, almost floating in the darkening air. Wish there were flower bds and trees, for this space is practically a wasteland to be used for events. Would compliment the view if it was made prettier.

title: Another angle to see the Taj
review: If you want to see the taj from the other side of river Yamuna,go to the Mahtab Bagh. Garden is also great to roam around. Personal opinion ,go in the evening and spend some time to see the wonder from this side.

title: Best place to see the Taj at sunset
review: The gardens are beautiful, but most importantly is it's strategic location across the Taj.

title: Taj Mahal from across the river at site of abandoned "black" Taj Mahal
review: The site of the never completed "black" Taj Mahal. Visit at sunset to see the change in colour of the " white" Taj Mahal across the river. A minor tourist site as only some foundations visible.

title: Must do in late afternoon.
review: This pretty garden has an amazing view of the back of the Taj Mahal from across the river. It's presently 100 rupees to enter.

title: Unexpectedly great!
review: We visited this garden because we reached Agra on Friday and Taj Mahal was closed. Personally, I wasn't expecting much but the view from Mehtab Garden was absolutely stunning. People told me that the garden had been recently revamped. It was clean and scenic. There's Yamuna that flows in between Mehtab and The Taj. The river is dirty and requires cleaning. Other than that, it is an absolute pleasure to watch the gigantic monument without any crowd and in 5 bucks! :D

title: Taj view Garden
review: This garden is across the Yamuna from the Taj Mahal.This is the spot where Shah Jahan had planned to build a black marble Taj for himself.The excavation was done and project dropped as he was deposed by his son.This is what the guides say.

title: Nice view of tajmahal
review: Always make you wonder grass is greener on the other side.

title: Too Hazy to see the sunset  and Taj Mahal
review: At this time of the year the only reason for visiting this garden is to view the Taj Mahal from the opposite of the river. Unfortunately the smog rolled in and the sun became harder to see so we left before sunset. However, the garden provides tantalising first view the Taj Mahal.

title: Good view - quickly done
review: Not that convenient to get to. A beautiful view of the Taj. Looks magnificent from your river-side vantage point. Go, see it amd leave. Combine this trip with the "Baby Taj" and other sites on this side of the river.

title: A different vantage point to see the Taj - go at sunset
review: One passes through a fairly unprepossessing park towards the river Yamuna. This allows an unrestricted view of the Taj Mahal over the river, next to a site said to have been allocated by Shah Jahan for another monument similar to the Taj, but in black. Further atmosphere to the setting sun turning the white marble pink, then beige, is added by the whisps of smoke drifting along the river from the crematorium a few hundred metres downstream...... A peaceful, reflective way to end the day and a good prelude to visiting the main site next day at dawn.

title: Perfect view of the Taj!
review: Mehtab Bagh or 'moonlight garden' or 'Chandni Bagh' are the gardens that were supposed to be the reflection of the beauty that lies infront of it, the Taj Mahal. With the nominal fee of ₹5 (100 for international citizens), it offers the perfect view of the Taj Mahal from the other side of the banks of Yamuna. We visited this place just in time for the sunset and were very pleased to be able to take some priceless shots with the dusky hues. Like the Taj, this garden is also open from sunrise till sunset. The plus of this garden, even though it's an iota of what it was envisioned as, you get to stand infront of the Taj for as long as you want, and without the crazy numbers that are inside the Taj. I wish they'd spend the nominal fee to increase it's upkeep, so that it can actually become the attraction it was to be.

title: What a hidden treasure
review: We arrived at Mehtab Bagh with no expectations and were totally blown away by the quite garden and the view of the Taj Mahal...I would highly recommend it early in the morning.

title: Outstanding uncrowded Dawn Views of the Taj Mahal
review: The gardens leading down to the river on the opposite of the river to the Taj Mahal offer great uncluttered views. Dawn just as the sun rises is the best time.

title: Nice...on a clear day!
review: Mahtab Bagh is across the Yamura River from the Taj Mahal. It was our first glimpse of the Taj but from the back. There is a charge for video cameras so be aware. They were working on the gardens so the paths were a mess. There was water standing that prevented walking on the path as it was muddy. The fountain wasn't working so the photos you see of the back of the Taj Mahal across the river with the sprinkler wasn't as beautiful. It was also very hazy but you could see huge lines of people going around the Taj Mahal as we were at Mahtab Bagh in the afternoon. We did some walking around the area that was thought by some to be the "Black Mahal" although there are now questions about this. Mughal emperor Shah Jahan was thought to want a mausoleum for himself and therefore started the "Black Mahal". I would recommend this place only if you have plenty of time in Agra as we did.

title: The moon light garden
review: Perfect view of Tajmahal from back side,Mehtab bag is a garden made by mughals which has fountains and beautiful plants,after all sightseeing u can visit this place in evening but before sunset,because it is only open from sunrise to sunset.

title: Best spot for photographs
review: We went there just before sunset and we could capture very beautiful pictures. It is also very peaceful, not too crowded

title: ANOTHER GREAT LOCATION!!!
review: This is great for the family to visit and children will love it. If your into your history this is the place to learn.

title: Rounded off a long day
review: We visited Mehtab Bagh at the end of our day long trip. There is nothing of real note to look at,  it's a quiet place to rest and remember the day just gone.

title: different view of taj
review: Less people visits this place, so my expectation was low. But after reaching there i found it very nice with a very beautiful view of tajmahal. Do visit if time permits.

title: Did a full moon night visit and a daytime visit.
review: This was both my 4th and 5th visit to this wonderful monument and it truly is one of the original 7 wonders of the world. The fog/smog made the night viewing poor, but the fog parted long enough the next day for a great view, The fog parted for us to get photos and then closed in again for some "different" photos.  The big pity here is there is a lot of money collected from tourists, but the areas outside are in dire need of clean up and be kept that.  Inside is brilliant.  Perhaps the Government should allocate some of the tax they have introduced for clean up and actually take some action.

title: Mehtab Bagh
review: Small little place to view the Taj. Our cab driver told us that shah Jahan was wanted to build the black Taj here but his plans were terminated by his son Aurangazeb..., you can still see the point of that proposed monument but the beauty of the Taj from this place is breathtaking ...,

title: Good place to visit
review: Mehtab bagh is a tourist spot for every one. Its behind the tajmahal.

title: Best view of Taj Mahal at sunset
review: This is a persian style garden at north of Taj Mahal (you CANNOT arrive there from Taj Mahal by walking, you need to take a taxi).

title: Must go if staying in Agra overnight
review: If you're not doing a day trip to Agra from Delhi and actually staying in Agra overnight I would recommend coming here for the sunset. If you have a day driver then I think you might as well. The thing that I loved the most was the mixture of wildlife along the river (massive flocks of birds) coupled with the epicness of the Taj Mahal over the hour or so we were there till sunset. Also, we didn't go into the garden itself, which costs 100 rupee to enter, but rather the public viewing area. The garden is probably more private with a long wall to sit on, so probably worth it to go in. Garden and public area separated by a small fence so you get the same views.

title: Best place to view Taj Mahal
review: Going to see the Taj Mahal was amazing, but I'm not a fan of crowds and I was there before the rush of people.  I would love to be on the Taj Mahal grounds when no one else is around, but doubtful that will ever happen.  However, going to Mehtab Bagh was a really good second option.  There's a great view of the back of the Taj Mahal in wonderful gardens and there were very few people there.

title: Across the river
review: We visited this in January 2016. As this was winter, visibility was poor due to the fog and smog. The river was also pretty dry. You cannot walk to this location and will need to organise transport by a car. There is a well kept and neat garden around this location but it is nothing to write home about.

title: Best View of Taj Mahal
review: Located at Etmadpur this park is behind Taj Mahal. You can see the entire Taj Mahal from this park and river Yamuna in the middle. Great time to visit this park is early morning and sunset.

title: Smog ruins the sunset
review: We went here for sunset. The smog is so bad that the sun disappears into it and therefore is a bit underwhelming. The park itself isn't anything special but is good for a sneak peak of the taj. I wouldn't go if I'd already been in the taj complex itself.

title: Best view of Taj at Sunset
review: We went to Agra during December 2015 (I and my daughter). Though I have visited Agra several 100 times the charm just goes on and on .....but somehow I never went to Mehtab Bagh.

title: Awesome view
review: From this area the beauty of Taj look more pretty with river o m g this is I like the best view of the Taj and the there is less people so peaceful area to view the Taj Mahal

title: A great view of Taj
review: It's a nice garden, you will see a lot of squirrel playing around. The best part is to walk here mindlessly and all on a sudden the appearance of the Taj! It was an exciting moment for me. You should visit it before visiting the Taj.

title: Nice spot
review: An alternative view to one of the world's great sights.   Worth a visit for that alone.  It is also worth while as the 'one-stop' tourists whizzing through Agra won't have time to get here and so it is far more relaxed than the Taj Mahal visit itself.

title: Akbar's Tomb
review: A concept of Mughal crypt which was not carried forward by his predecessor. If staying in Agra for a long time then worth visiting the place.

title: Amazing view of Taj
review: Mehtab bagh is located on the Yamuna side of opposite bank of Taj Mahal.

title: The Black Taj
review: Well maintained . Should not be visited on a foggy day.There is nothing much to see just a normal garden.

title: Away from maddening crowd!
review: The garden provides an unhindered view of Taj from the back and best part is that the entry is free.Best time to visit is after noon. The garden gives you a relaxed and picturesque view of this wonderful monument.

title: Good view from the other side of the river
review: Not much in the garden, however good view of the Taj from the other side of the river, it is kept clean, need a car to go over the bridge.

title: The Taj - awe inspiring back view!
review: We were enroute to our hotel from Delhi & asked our guide to show us an interesting place in the hour before sunset. We were pleasantly surprised to see Mehtab Bagh. The garden had no flowers as it was December but it had a glorious view of the Taj in the setting sun. The garden also has an incomplete excavation of historical importance.

title: Lovely
review: We reached at Mehtab Bagh about an hour before the sunset, well due to traffic madness.

title: Visit it to see the back view of TAJ and the river
review: as a garden it is Okayish

title: Expensive and useless
review: The gardens are charmless. The view if the Taj Mahal is nice but you can have the same for free along the river. You can also hire a boat for the same price and have the view without the other tourists.

title: Absolutely not worth a visit
review: Absolutely not worth a visit !!! If you want the pictures of Taj Mahal from the river side do not go into this overpriced garden but go about 100 meters along the area to the river where you have the same view and free access.

title: Awesome Sunset view of Taj Mahal
review: Anyone visiting Agra, must go here at sunset time. It's great place to enjoy awesome sunset view from here.

title: Quiet Gardens across the river from the Taj Mahal
review: This garden is a nice place to escape the hustle and bustle. It'd be a great place to bring a picnic and a bottle of wine, and it offers a nice view of the Taj Mahal that you don't typically see. Many people go here to see the Taj Mahal at sunset.

title: best place to see tajmahal during sunset
review: This is a beautiful garden from where you can see the full view of Tajmahal. There is an entrance fees of rs 100.

title: Great place
review: First things first, do hire a guide if you can who can take you to good spots in the garden. Best time to go is around sunset as you can get nice sunset photos of the The Taj from across the river. It also has some features like King's place where he sat to watch Taj Mahal and you can get the same view. Also it will help you get an architectural view of some of the things that you cannot see from the front or closer.Bagh has lots of flowers (seasonal) which will lighten up your mood. Lastly this is free for all and does not require a ticket whereas front entry to the Taj Mahal will cost foreign tourist Rs 750.

title: Mehtab bag
review: Its just behind Taj Mahal. You can view the back side the of the Taj Mahal. Pls note that Taj Mahal is similar in view from all the four side

title: Dilapidated garden, good only for Taj views and photography.
review: Went there on a Friday as Taj was closed for prayers. The location provides quite a good unhindered view of Taj across the river which is great for a photographer. The garden itself is not worth to stroll around.

title: A different view
review: You can see the Taj from the back-side, getting a unique photo opportunity while looking across the river.

title: Great location but not maintained
review: I would say this is one of the best locations to sit and admire the beautiful Taj Mahal. Located right across the Yamuna behind Taj this garden gives one the best locations for a fabulous viewing and clicking pictures but sadly the garden has nothing to offer. The administration can do wonders by developing and maintaining the area. Still a place worth going in the evening where you can sit and enjoy a nice sunset view of the Taj Mahal

title: Taj from the river bank
review: Most people visit at sunset and its a wonderful sight. Free of charge and not crowded. People linger here and its quite ethereal as the sun sets on this beautiful monument. Can often see cremation ghats across the holy river Yamuna. You will need a car and driver to locate this peaceful but remote area.

title: Sunset view of Taj Mahal
review: Mehtab Bagh is the perfect place for getting Sunset Click of 7th wonder of world. To reach Mehtab Bagh you have to book a vechele from Agra city itself as no shared auto/car is running.

title: A view of the Taj from the bank
review: Visited this place on suggestion from a colleague as he suggested that the view is great from this park. The view was quite good. However , he suggested it'd be better when the weather is overcast/cloudy as the Taj shines when that is the case and it really looks beautiful. Would suggest this to be a point for an outing when the weather is overcast.

title: Nice and Different
review: Though at first visit you will find this as a ordinary garden . But if you are interested in clicking photos you must visit this place. The uniqueness lies that you take a pic in the evening sunset time and get a nice scenery of Taj mahal back. This is a must in  excellent collection of your pics.

title: Garden is useless, only for Taj Mahal and Yamuna View visit this place
review: Garden is useless, only for Taj Mahal and Yamuna View visit this place. There is nothing special in that garden , hardly few flowers were there . and it was not lush green. If the fog was lesser we also would have got a crystal clear view of Taj Mahal. but nice place for taking pics.

title: Great views in the morning of the Taj Mahal!
review: This is a beautiful garden that you should visit at sunrise to get the best morning view of the Taj Mahal.  It's really nicely kept, and when we were there, not very busy, so we got some terrific views and shots.

title: Awesome view
review: Mehtab Bagh is famous for enjoying awesome view of Taj Mahal. The view is completely different and the background is awesome if you take a picture.

title: nice place
review: it is situate at charbagh complex it is a historical place.it is opposite of agra fort and north of taj mahal...

title: Awesome experience
review: Mehtab Bagh is really beautiful and this is another eye-catching place other than white marble structure. It lies north of the Taj Mahal complex and the Agra fort on the opposite side of Yamuna River. You can take the perfect picture of Taj Mahal from any point of the garden as this is the architecture of this garden. This garden have clean pools with fountains, and shaded pavilions within trees, beautiful fragrant flowers and native shrubbery. Do visit Mehtab Bagh if you ever plan to go to Taj Mahal as not everyone is aware of the location of this place.

title: most peaceful viewing of taj..
review: a very quiet place...bang opp TAJ MAHAL on opp bank of yamuna...we can view and leisurely ogle at THE TAJ MAHAL in a setting of peace,quiet and calm...as opposed to the chaos at taj mahal itself.

title: Beautiful view
review: Wonderful to see the taj from the back!  I went at sunset, but the air pollution meant that there wasn't actually really a sunset.  The view is beautiful, and wonderful to see the without being jostled by many many tourists.

title: Another View of Taj !!
review: If you want to savour the magic of Taj Mahal from a quieter place … this is the ideal place to be. The Taj is visible from the back side with River Yamuna flowing between the Bagh & Taj. The garden is okay… could be maintained well to make it majestic.

title: Stunning views from this Moghul Garden
review: We watched the sunset on the Taj Mahal from here much as Shah Jahan would have (or would have planned to anyway). One of the highlights of our trip. The gardens have been nicely planted and some scents are there as was originally planned.

title: mehrab bagh
review: you can see taj very clearly from this bagh...nice thought place of the moghal for creating such memorable places for us

title: Excellent view of Taj Mahal without visiting Taj complex
review: Mehtab baug is situated opposite side of Taj Mahal. It is a place where you get best view of Taj without going to the Taj complex. While anybody going to Agra will not want to miss Taj Mahal anyway. However this place is exactly for people who want to view Taj from a distance after visiting the Taj. It is just a park but the views are awesome for pictures. Must visit. There is a small entry ticket.

title: Good view of Taj
review: Taj mahal can be viewed from mehtab bagh easily.  It is a nice and lovely garden.  It is situated across yamuna river.

title: Other View for Taj
review: The garden was in existence many years before the Taj was built, unlike the popular belief that Shah Jahan made it to view Taj. The Back side of Taj can be viewed from this point with Yamuna river flowing in between, with opportunities for taking some nice photos of Taj. The garden is Okay and not well maintained, would be great if it is improved.

title: Good for a sunset visit
review: the park is not so interesting and it is a drive through traffic to get to but you do get to see the Taj Mahal from a unique vantage point across the river and at sunset, the sun lights up the back of the Taj.   If you are in Agra for a day, skip it, go to the Taj and the Agra Fort instead.

title: Sunset viewing of Taj Mahal across Yamuna River!
review: Watched the sunset from Mehtab Bagh of Taj Mahal across Yamuna River. Must do in Agra!!! The view is beautiful and the photos even better!!

title: Good..... if you have time.. must go there
review: Not many tourists visit this place. But if you have time and simply want to relax a bit, you must visit this place. Important to note, Shahjahan wanted to build Black Taj at this place intended to be used for his burial place. If you go to this place, watch out of some foundation and brick work; it’s exactly similar to that of the Taj.

title: Peaceful experience
review: Located right across the Taj, across the river Yamuna, this place is somewhere you can have a quiet picnic with the view of the magnificent monument in the backdrop. There're a number of tourists but it's not as crowded as the Taj or the Agra Fort. It is mostly clean but don't expect much, though it is quite well maintained. There is a ticket for visiting. Outside there are number of shops for eatables and souvenirs, but try not to get ripped off.

title: Ok, but not really worth it
review: We visited for sunset to view the Taj Mahal from the other side of the river. The view is ok, but not great. Take insect repellent as there are lots of biting insects. The gardens are dull and not worth visiting, other than the view of the Taj.

title: Vantage point to see Taj Mahal at sunset
review: The gardens are nice and this is the best place to see the Taj Mahal at sunset. Be warned that parking is difficult and that the traffic on leaving was totally grid locked so took ages to get back to hotel

title: A classic for sunset
review: This is the place where nearly everybody goes to watch sunset at Taj Mahal. The park is situated Yamuna River directly oposite Taj Mahal.The park itself is a bit boring and not really beautiful, But usually you won't go here because of the park iself but just for sunset. It's probably the best place for sunset. However, the sun doesn't go down directly behind Taj Mahal and therefore I was a bit disappointed as it was not that dramatic / spectacular as I expected.

title: Wastage of time.
review: There is nothing much to see at the mehtab bagh.

title: Nice garden to view Taj
review: This is place for Shahjahan's tomb which was not completed. From this place one can see Taj Mahal completely. If fog is not disturbing than can get great view.

title: Good views of the 3 buildings but seriously over priced!
review: The Mehtab Bagh Park offers good views of the Taj Mahal, the mosque and it's mirroring building across from the river, however the entry for the park is 100RS and I really don't think it is worth it!! The park itself has nothing, just some dry grass - but if u don't mind paying the views might be worth it. Be careful to come back earlier as it's hard getting a rickshaw to take you back to Taj Ganj in the evening.

title: the ultimate nearing to Taj
review: Sitting in this simple garden, you can witness supremacy of taj with shortest possible distance. famous bollywood songs picturization loacation.

title: nice garden
review: garden is very nice and they have many flowers in this garden they give me attraction lika a mughal period.

title: Most Neglected Moghul Garden - in sad state
review: This is a Garden from Moghul era just behind where Taj Mahal is located but on the other side of the River Yamuna. It takes quite some time to reach here as the route is longer and congested. We visited this place to get a different view of Taj Mahal during the evening time. The entire place is in bad shape despite the fact that "Mehtab Bagh" (Moon Light garden) was created by Moghul Emperors for pleasure. There are everal stories associated with this place - some sort of construction was tried here which never got completed because the Archeologists have found here ruins of a Pond and several fountains. Its also believed that Shahjehan wanted to construct a Black Marble Tomb for himself at this site.

title: There is a better view, for free, from down the small road to the river.....
review: We made the mistake of going into the gardens (Well - scrubby area of hedges and stuff) to get photographs of the Taj at sunset.  The Gardens are directly across the river from the Taj. And that the problem - as the sun sets to the West the best view is slightly to one side exposing the West face of the Taj.

title: Best view of Taj
review: They say, it was made to see Taj on moonlit night. True. It gives the best view of Taj. Just opposite the Taj on the other bank of river Yamuna, this beautiful garden is cool, peaceful and should not be missed.

title: Overrated
review: It’s a long way to get there, and the promised view of the Taj Mahal is not as good as you think. Electric wires spoil to possibility of a good photo and unless the river is full you can't get the reflection of the Taj in the water, very popular by loud and noisy local tourists.

title: Sunset View of the Taj Mahal
review: We so wanted to get some killer shots but the sunset was really in the wrong place.....we were quite disappointed.....but still worth a night visit....very romantic.

title: I really don't get it...
review: ....though the view is nice, it is almost the same as right next to the gardens for absolutely free (garden entry is 100 rupees).

title: The best view of Taj & Yamuna river.
review: The garden itself is yet to manage o optimum as in compare to the garden of Taj Mahal, but still it's a place to visit in Agra. You have to pass a long way from the man city by a rented vehicle as there is no proper public transport to reach there.

title: By the river
review: This is probably the best place to quietly enjoy the Taj. From here you can see the Taj quietly and in its majestic entirety. I came here in the afternoon just before sunset and it's such a joy to be able to see the white done turn yellow gold and pink as the sun sets. The vision of the Taj by the river with water birds and reeds framing the scene will always be a very distinct memory in my mind.

title: Good view of the Taj
review: This is the place to get photographs of the Taj at sunset. This is also a place to see hard working women attending goats and gathering wood for cooking fires.

title: Taj view
review: We went to see the Taj from the other side of the river. Were able to take photos without lots of people in the photo.  Good to see a different view

title: Nice view of Taj Mahal
review: Though I didn't like the garden very much but this is the right place to have a nice view of Taj Mahal. The garden is located at the opposite side of Taj. If you want to avoid the crowd of Taj then please go to this place and take some nice clicks of the great monument Taj Mahal.

title: Don't Give Money to Those Begging Children
review: These gardens were amazing, and not very busy at all!! Who doesn't want unobstructed views of the Taj? It blew my mind that there was almost no one here - except children playing. Well... I thought they were just innocent children until you get closer and they swarm you, asking "Money please?" It was so brazen I was caught off guard. When I said no, they asked, "Pens? Chocolate? Gum?" Like, what DO you have for us??? They then posed for pictures. I'm assuming they do this all day. We made the mistake of pulling out some money for them, and a SWARM of kids appeared out of nowhere, grabbing from us. I highly recommend to not make our mistake ( I read not to give to them as more would appear suddenly but I didn't realize it was that bad) and just ignore them and keep to yourself... If you want to give, it's a personal decision, but it can be overwhelming to get swarmed like that.

title: Not so pleasing view
review: Security guards do not allow you stay beyond 18:30 hours to stay and watch the Taj in the moon light. No proper place to sit except on the bare mud floor. Transport is not there and since there is minimum public transport available, auto wala's charge you more like a flight ticket.

title: Kings view of the great Taj - amazing
review: From this bank of Yamuna river one can view this white marble marvel flanked by the two red sandstone constructions. if one's lucky you will get to witness a wonderful sky with dusk hues. But this time I have to settle with just bank side view and not the sunset. Not many are interested to watch this garden but I feel this must be in itinerary if one likes to watch the taj in various perspectives and enjoy.

title: Awesome, Awesome & Awesome
review: See the Taj from a different perspective.

title: Must visit after Taj Mahal
review: - Its across the river, right opposite the Taj Mahal, on the banks of the Yamuna

title: sunset view of Taj
review: Parking is on the road.

title: Good View of Taj... Avoidable..
review: Mehtab bagh is an ordinary garden with an extraordinary view.   This garden is located across the river from the Taj. This is the place where a number of cultural shows take place with the Taj Mahal as a background. Nothing fancy about the garden in itself.

title: Nice to get a new perspective on the Taj
review: Great place to get a good view of the Taj. The park is just across the river from the Taj, it is quiet and peaceful. You'll have to pay Rs. 100 (non-Indian) + a rickshaw ride from wherever you are and back (you'll probably have to make your driver wait for you as almost no rickshaws stay there). Definitely a great way to enjoy this amazing wonder.

title: Resting Place for Tired Tourists
review: in the afternoon when sun is gone down or at moonlight this garden is best place to see Tajmahal from.everyone must visit this garden sit for a while beside Jamuna River. and just enjoy the view it will rejubinate energy  and you will never forget it

title: Must go in evening
review: It is a average kind of garden, which is not very well maintained but it is best place to see Taj in evening. Sit on the bank of yamuna  river and enjoy sunset view of Taj. Watch your steps and be careful if are visiting with kids as excavation work at many places in the garden is going on.

title: Different view of the Taj Mahal.
review: Obviously it has a great view of the Taj Mahal with a different view point.  Worth visiting early or sunset to get the best lighting

title: Bagh
review: Huge garden area and view of Taj from behind.

title: Another angle of Taj
review: This was a nice trip of the day as we went to other place to see the magnificent Taj. The Indians were so kind to take photos of us and it was fun!

title: mehtab bagh
review: opposite taj on the other side of yamuna river the unfinished or rather un started taj in black marble..with garden.can see it from taj

title: Great spot for sunset viewing of the Taj
review: The gardens are quite pretty, however the area next to the river is a bit shabby. This is naturally where you gravitate toward to get as close to the Taj Mahal as possible.  The rundown fence and dirt paths are not as lovely as the gardens, but still a nice place to contemplate the beauty of the Taj.

title: Amazing uncrowded visit
review: Another amazing experience after visiting Taj Mahal. No crowd, beautiful view, cheap, amazing for taking photographs. Best around 5 pm as you can sit and enjoy Taj Mahal in the sunset.

title: wonder full view of tajmahol.
review: it is so beautyfull place in agra. If Shahjahan made a BlaCK Tajmahal IN Mehetab bag it should be more beautyfull.

title: visitrajasthan private tour & taxi - A day tour
review: This is come on the way of Taj mahal  " Delhi to Agara"

title: Taj Mahal view
review: We didn't go to the site but went down the road alongside to the river to see the Taj Mahal from a different angle. Worth going round to see it - much quieter than at the site itself.

title: View Taj from Mehtab Bagh
review: It provides a different perspective to view taj from opposite side of the river. The garden is well maintained and reflection of Taj on river Yamuna can be seen during monsoon. King Shahjahan planned to construct the black taj Mahal here which remained incomplete.Good place to spend in evening at Agra.

title: Great Sunset view of the Taj Mahal
review: We visited these gardens because had seen them recommended on TA. We were not disspointed. We arrived probably too early an hour or so before sunset but this meant we had a good position on the wall opposite the Taj to see the sun sink in the sky and colours change. We could also see the massive queues to get inside the building so were glad we were visiting at sunrise next day. By time sunset came there was quite a large crowd of us standing there in silence watching the colours change - a lovely experience

title: Lovely Place
review: I visit Mehtab Bagh with my wife, its is very good place for plant and nature lover. i love Mehtab Bagh and once again visit this.

title: #2 after visiting the Taj Mahal
review: Mehtab Bagh, or Sunset point is a very beautiful tranquil place, it offers stunning views of the Taj from a different perspective and is well worth the 250 rupee entry fee.

title: Over rated
review: If it was not for the view of TAJ, you can very safely drop this from you list. As a photographer is was more disappointing as there is a long fencing done and you cannot even get close to the banks of the river. So a few less photos is the collection

title: brilliant views of the Taj !
review: This place was actually the site where the black Taj was supposed to be built....but the plan was foiled by Shah Jahan's son who felt that it was a useless expense....the place is now a nice garden and offers the most splendid views of the Taj from across the yamuna river....this is the best place to click pictures sans the maddening crowds of the Taj Mahal....entry is Rs 10 for indians and Rs 100 for foriegn nationals....

title: Best view of Taj
review: Its situated across the Yamuna river. You can get breathtaking view of Taj from other side of the river. Very pleasant with gardent and river side. Perfect place for couple :)

title: WOW
review: it gives you a nice view of Taj Mahal. Huge Garden  sorrounded with many fruits though the maintenance needed more push but still fine.

title: The other side of the Taj
review: Worth the ride to see the Taj form the other side of the river the not so seen side of the Taj is also very beautiful. excellent location for a Picnic

title: An island of calm and tranquility, with the best view in town
review: An island of calm and tranquility amongst the crowds, with an amazing view of the Taj. You can actually take a photo without another 3000 people blocking the view... :)

title: View of the Taj
review: Come for one a great view of the Taj (without hundreds of other people around you). The park itself is not worth mentioning.

title: Great place to see another side of the Taj Mahal
review: It's a great place to go in order to see the Taj Mahal from behind. It's a nice garden, where the black Taj Mahal was supposed to be raised. It was much more quiet and less people when we went, by the sunrise.

title: picturesque garden
review: pretty garden at the back of Taj where we can sit and enjoy. Taj's view is superb from here and we can click many great pictures in the garden.

title: The Taj at Sunset
review: This is a great location from which to view the Taj Mahal across the Yamuna River. You will have to pay for the pleasure, at a little kiosk at the roadside, to enter the park. Beware that camera tripods are not allowed and they will be taken from you until you return to the kiosk, thankfully it was still there when we went to pick it up.

title: If you have not been here, you have not seen taj right.
review: The taj has to be seen from Mehtab bagh to get the complete picture, either at sunrise of at sunset. Otherwise you taj visit has not completed.

title: What A View
review: This is a place where everyone should visit because it's view to the symbol of Eternal love "The Taj Mahal" ,from this place you have a view which can not be seen from inside the TAJ MAHAL.

title: The Taj Mahal from a different view
review: If you have time during your Agra visit this place is worth visiting because it will give you a different view of the Wonderful Taj Mahal, you can sit down in the shade of some trees and sit there with a clear unobstructed view of the Taj Mahal.

title: The other side of Taj
review: Must be watched from the banks of river Yamuna , its beautiful and breath taking , hope the govt can control    buffalo movement in this area .

title: Better, quieter view of Taj
review: Those who want to escape the crowds and admire beauty of Taj from a decent distance for hours, dont miss Mehtab Bag. We sat here for over two hours looking at the monument, not being disturbed by photographers, guides or any one else. We enjoyed Mehtab bag visit more than the actual Taj Mahal visit, as it offered peaceful time with the monument.

title: stunning
review: it gives a geat view of the taj mahal with a fraction of the rush at taj mahal. went with my wife and she absolutely loved it. sunset is the best time to visit.

title: Not recommended to visit
review: Just garden nothing special you can see there just Taj Mahal from different side

title: Must see after Taj Mahal
review: A nice place to see Incredible Taj Mahal. It would have  been better if river would have been flowing from bank to bank. There was so little water in the river. When the water is calmer then a wonderful reflection image of Taj amahal can be captured. Overall it provides another perspective to Taj Mahal.

title: Mehtab Bag a worth
review: This is hidden gem worth a visit, and not crowded. It's on opposite side of main Taj entrance, and worth a visit.

title: Underrated place to view the Taj
review: Oh, Mehtab Bagh. The underrated place to enjoy the Taj. I often end up here when in Agra, perhaps provides a better view than the Taj complex (we've all seen and tried to take pictures of the Taj reflected in the river).

title: The place where I feel.. Taj is only for me...
review: After three visits, finally this time I manage to go to Mehtab Bagh. As the name says, a beautiful and colorful garden with an outstanding view of Taj. Best part, you feel like the king here coz no one else will get bombed into your photo frame. Extremely low on crowd (hardly 20 ppl around on a Sunday) but safe as enough security personal are around. Multiple points to capture scenic beauty of Taj, its reflection on Yamuna, the breeze, the birds and the flowers all together. If you are on a day trip this is the place to combine with main building of Taj. My suggestion, on a one day trip dedicated to Taj, must visit this place to enjoy the beauty of The Symbol of Love. Or if you are for two days in Agra, first day should go for Taj and Local Market and 2nd day start with Mehtab Bagh followed by the Red Fort. This place is quite far from the main city (Approx. 10 -12 KM) and u must have your own conveyance (Hired or personal) for to and fro. Auto Rickshaw will charge you aprox Rs 400 from City to Mahtab bagh to Agra Fort (including waiting time). At the end, a hidden place which gives you the royal view of Taj…

title: Seeing is Believeing: Unexplored Other Side of Taj Mahal
review: Most of the Travellers to Taj Mahal will not make it here.

title: Great View of the Taj from here
review: This is the best place to visit if you want to see the sunset over the majestic Taj Mahal. the greenery and wonderful gardens also add up to the experience.

title: Great back view of Taj
review: This place itself is nothing but an ordinary park, but it gives you an unadulterated view of Taj which you will enjoy and cherish. Best part is it is not crowded and gives you ample time to stare and enjoy this building. Take a camel ride outside.

title: Great View of Taj Mahal in the opposite bank
review: Reached Mehtab Bagh at about 530pm and the security still let us enter the park. We went to the river and wait for the sunset. It's really beautiful when the sunray settle on the magnificent Taj Mahal, which makes it looks like orange and a little purplish. Not many foreigners were here, but it's definitely worth a visit especially during the evening.

title: Visit at sunset ...
review: A perfect place to view the Taj before you actually visit it. You can get unique photo opportunities/views that you don't get when you are actually at the Taj site. The gardens are lovely and at sunset they were not crowded. Sunset is recommended because of the lighting on the Taj for fantastic photos. The gardens might be difficult to navigate to if you did not have a guide ... they are not anywhere close to town.

title: Hidden secret for great photos of Taj Mahal
review: This is the place to go for a great photo of the Taj Mahal at sunset. We went a bit earlier and wandered around the gardens trying to find a peacock. Could hear them but not see them.

title: See taj mahal in green environmental place
review: Mehtab Bagh is great location to see taj mahal in green environmental place.This garden has various variety of flower and fruit trees planted in.

title: Make sure you ask for your ticket as you walk in.
review: We visited the park to get a different perspective of the Taj.

title: another way to see the taj
review: its an alternate way to see the taj, where you go behind the taj to see it. not busy at all and honestly, we prefered to see the taj this way

title: The other side of Taj!
review: This is a wonderful place, although, highly neglected from where the Taj Mahal can be viewed in a completely different manner. See it to believe it.

title: garden as the name says
review: pretty view but of course you need to pay to get in. It is nothing but a garden overlooking the Taj Mahal. I guess if you like photography and stuff, it's worth the money but otherwise there is nothing much to see.

title: Foundation of Black Taj
review: This is the place where Shahjahan was about to build his own Makbara- same replica of Tajmahal  in black stone . But due to Aurangjeb he could not do it other then the identifying of the place.

title: Visit if you have time
review: Shahjahan wanted to build a black taj mahal there. He couldn't because his own son imprisoned him while the foundations were being laid. Please read about it. That place is more then just a beautiful park.

title: a garden from where you can see Taj
review: this is the background of Taj mahal from where you can see the back side of taj and Yamuna river both. A nnice place to visit if you want to explore another side of wonder.

title: well maintained garden with excellent Taj view
review: If you are in Agra on friday, there is no better place to view Taj than Mehtab Bagh. a best place for photography of Taj at sun set. we have seen a lot of color change of Taj as sun set.

title: Excellent way to see Taj
review: It is the excellent way to see Taj. Mehtab bagh gives a perfect scenic exposure to Taj Mahal. Also known for Moonlight view of Taj. Though due to shortage of time did not get time.

title: “A peaceful view of the Taj Mahal”
review: Mahtab bag is Place to view the Taj from across the river Yamuna. A best place for photography of Taj at sun set. we have seen a lot of color change of Taj as sun set. . It gives a view of Taj which is away from crowd. Also, from here only you can see full Taj at a glance.

title: Serene
review: This was a quite and calming place when I visited in the evening. It offers a different view of the Taj Mahal. A very picturesque one, at that.

title: Lovely alternate view of the Taj Mahal
review: This is a beautiful garden to wander in itself- but its real key is see the Taj Mahal from the back, with the river between. It doesn't detract from its beauty, in fact its another way to appreciate it. Best time to visit is late afternoon. Go and sit on the ruined wall under the trees (towards the left) and soak up a very peaceful way to experience the Taj Mahal.

title: the ruins and foundation of the black taj
review: the Mehtab bagh is the ruins and foundation of the black taj Shahjahan proposed to build on the opposite side of the river bank as a mirror image of the taj but could not be completed as he was overthrown from the throne by his son Aurangzeb.

title: It was good
review: It was good to visit this place to view the Taj Mahal from another point of view. Bring repelent for the mosquitos! There were lots of mosquitos. It's good to go in the late afternoon.

title: good place to seesun go down over Taj Mahal
review: park across river from taj mahal. Park a bit empty and isolated although a crowd at water edge overlooking Taj  The park closes at sun set so we had to leave as soon as sun set  . It is also claimed to be site of the black version of Taj mahal

title: Very nice
review: I have visited in this park 1st time and found that very green location available near to Taj Mahal. In this bagh lots of variety of tress available in this park.

title: Awesome Taj Mahal view
review: Probably one of the best spot to take photographs for the Taj. Beautiful garden and the river in the middle. Very peaceful and well maintained.

title: Most amazing place to view the taj!
review: We were a little apprehensive during the drive to this place about what kind of view we were going to get, but don't be put off, it's beautiful! We arrived at around 5.30, DONT be put off as we were that the park closes at 6pm ( also don't stay at the retreat hotel in Agra: but that's a different review!), and were treated to a fab couple of hours taking pictures and enjoying the golden glow of the taj from across the river.

title: A good of the Taj
review: A nice place to see the Taj. Don't pay to go in the garden, just walk down the dirt track for 50m. Lots of people trying to sell you stuff, but no different to anywhere else.

title: Lovely view of Taj across the Yamuna
review: Mehtab Bagh is located right opposite the Taj on the other side of the Yamuna. highly recommended for sunset views . The garden itself is nothing great but the view of the Taj against the Yamuna is absolutely awesome. Not to be missed

title: Moon Garden
review: Good spot to ake photos of the Taj Mahal, pity the old fountain isn't restored, or at least cordoned off so the public can't do any more damage

title: An altnerative view!
review: during our recent trip to India our tour guide took us to Mehtab Bagh. We hadn't read ant rip advisor review for this attraction quite simply because we didn't mind what it was like as long as we could view the Taj!

title: Amazing view of back of Taj Mahal
review: Less crowded and one can get an amazing view of the back side of Taj Mahal with the Yamuna river in between..This place also has the foundation of the Black Taj Mahal which was supposed to be built here...

title: Great way to preview the Taj
review: We went the evening before we visited the full site. Great views from across the river and so quiet - there were only about 50 or so people gazing in tranquility. It was an add on to our tour, but well worth it!

title: An unusual view of the Taj
review: The view of the Taj Mahal across the Yamuna River from the Mehtab Bagh garden is a special one, particularly at sunset. The garden was fairly deserted when we visited and it was a lovely way to finish our memorable day of sightseeing in Agra.

title: A peaceful view of the Taj Mahal
