review: Mehtab Bagh was the first on our itinerary during our Agra-Jaipir-Delhi trip. We arrived here early in the morning and we were the only ones who were at the park with our driver. The entrance fee for foreigners is Rs. 100 and it is worth it. The park isn't very big and as we were walking, the Taj gradually came out from the background. It was amazing! We were taken in by the Taj's majestic beauty from this park across the Yamuna River. At one point, we heard bird's chirping and the full panorama of the Taj Mahal came. There is alot of photo opportunities and we just loved every minute we spent here. I would definitely recommend a visit to Mehtab Bagh simply to get an alternative view of the Taj Mahal without the crowds.

title: Excellent view of the Taj
review: If you are in Agra to see the Taj Mahal, after you are done with the normal visit. Visit this park to get an excellent view of the Taj. Also known as the moonlight garden, lies on the opposite side of the Yamuna River.

title: One of the lesser known areas of Agra - excellent view of the Taj
review: This one of Agra's best kept secrets, well maintained gardens and amazing views of the Taj Mahal during Dawn or Dusk.

title: Otherside of the Taj
review: Mahtab bag is Place to view the Taj from across the river Yamuna. The park needs the pavement done for convenience of tourist. It gives a view of Taj which is away from crowd. A night view is being planned but yet to take off. Park is otherwise typical Mughal park in design.

title: Good view of Taj, nice garden but not much else there
review: A peaceful garden on the opposite side of the river Yamuna to the Taj Mahal so you get some excellent views of the Taj from here. We visited on a Thursday afternoon but it would probably be worth going on a Friday when the Taj is shut to get photos while no-one is wandering around the Taj.

title: great sunset view of Taj
review: I disliked only the begging children - be careful,  dont take photos of them, they will follow you everywhere asking for money or chocolate!

title: Sort of a Hidden Gem
review: Not many or rather almost none of the Indian tourists know about this place ... because when i was there all i could find were the locals and the western crowd ... Watching Taj from here is a different experience altogether ... Come here for the sunset and you'll thank me later hehe

title: A great place to sit and watch the sun set over the Taj Mahal
review: We arrived at the park about half an hour or so before sunset.  The park was almost completely empty - just a few people wondering about.  We sat on the wall of the old ruins and watched the sun slowly set.  The changes in colour of the Taj Mahal and the expanse of the Yamuna River as the sun set was just amazing.  It was breathtakingly beautiful and hardly a soul there to see it.  Wonderful.

title: Nice views but very restriced.
review: We went there to get views of the Taj from across the Yammuna river and they were nice, but we really wanted to walk downstream a little to be able to get pics with more of the river in front of the taj.  The area is well guarded and they do not let you walk outside of the garden to get better pics.

title: phew
review: what a sight of the TAJ mahal from the backyard. a very sensible thought for Friday onlookers. i did thoroughly enjoty my Friday watching the TAJ the whole day changing colours

title: For the Taj Mahal views
review: The different perspective it gives of the Taj Mahal make this worth a short visit.  The park is quite nice actually but the lack of amenities make it less attractive unless you are a local looking for some privacy with a friend.  Make an afternoon of places on the other side of the river and make sure to include Itimad-ud-Daulah.

title: View the Taj Mahal from a different perspective
review: Most people come here just to see the view of the Taj Mahal from across the river. The gardens are not the main attraction. We visited late afternoon and the sky was full of birds. We just got all our photos before it started to rain! Seemed to be mainly western tourists here. Worth coming for the view, small entry fee.

title: Mahtab Bagh- A unique place to view the Taj Mahal
review: Mahtab Bagh located across the river Yamuna from the Taj Mahal is a perfect place to view the Taj Mahal minus the jostling crowds. One can actually sit in peace and admire the monument. I was the only person in the garden when I visited and could admire the Taj for over an hour. I could not help pity the people crowding the Taj Mahal and I could see them clearly. The Bagh is open during daylight hours and can be accessed after paying a nominal entry fee of Rs 5/head. You can check out my blog on Mahtab Bagh at www.wanderndiscover.wordpress.com for more details

title: A little disappointing
review: Not as quiet as the reviews said - when we arrived just before sunset we saw many coaches, cars and tuk-tuks parked up and in the gardens themselves were lots of people. While stood across form the Taj Mahal there were quite a few children asking for money to take photos of them. The sunset wasn't as spectacular as thought it would be either - the sun doesn't actually set behind the Taj Mahal but to the far right of the river. There's a smog across the river from the funeral pyres and lots of small bits floating in the air - I actually got an eye infection the day after and think it was from the air pollution here! An okay place to come to see a different perspective of the Taj Mahal, but otherwise there's not much else to see.

title: A very good place for sunset on Taj Mahal
review: This nice little garden will give you the opportunity to see sunset on Taj Mahal. The garden by itself is quiet and nice. If you're tied by your day come here during the afternoon and rest quietly waiting for the sunset.

title: the perfect place for that perfect shot of the Taj Mahal
review: The garden is quite beautiful and is worth spending time at just by itself but it gets even better when you see the Taj Mahal from here. It just cant get more beautiful than this :)

title: Well worth visiting for an uncrowded view of the Taj Mahal.
review: The gardens themselves are reasonably well kept, with some minor excavation work of what are potentially historical remains taking place.  The real reason for visiting, however, is the view of the Taj across the Yamuna River, amongst scores rather than thousands of people.  The view at sunset, which unfortunately we missed, would be particularly attractive.

title: A different perspective on Taj
review: The gardens aren't as manicured as those at the Taj Mahal.  But they are very nice, and great uncrowded walk to see the other side of the Taj.  Climb up a levee to get good shots of the Taj with the river in front.  Great location for Sunset pictures - crematorium smoke gives the sun an orange glow, and if you can get a flock of birds going by too...  Another good photo op are the goat herders bringing in their animals with the Taj backdrop.

title: Uncrowded view on the Taj
review: I was disappointed by these very simple (and dry) gardens. But you can still have a nice view on the Taj (without the crowd) from the other side of the river...

title: Excellent venue to see the Taj at sunset
review: My guide offered me two times to see the Taj Mahal, actually going to the site at sunrise (which we did) and going to this place to view the Taj Mahal at sunset.

title: Taj, across Yamuna River
review: It can be brilliant idea to see Taj Mahal from the Back side, across Yamuna River. It is not possible in the high monsoon time.

title: Rear View of the Taj
review: This is a huge garden with a million dollar view of the rear of the Taj Mahal from across the river. Nice place to stroll around and escape the crowds and traffic.

title: Great view of the Taj Mahal.
review: Gardens that are pleasant to stroll in, but the main attraction is a great view of the Taj Mahal from across the river.

title: Memorable!!
review: Couldn't have realised what's there until a visit to this place. The garden is no doubt beautiful, but the biggest speciality is the back side view of Taj Mahal...

title: Alternative view of the Taj Mahal
review: We visited the Mehtab Bagh the afternoon before we visited the Taj Mahal at dawn so that we could view it at dusk - I would definitely recommend you do this as it shows the Taj Mahal in a different light.  It was a stunning view, and there wasn't lots of people there so you could quietly stand there, staring at the beautiful view across the river.

title: opposite the Taj
review: a lot less visited but with a great view of the Taj. You will find a lot of birds by the river and the local people walking past in the evening. However no Tripods allowed even outside of the garden.

title: Closer view than expected
review: We went to see the sunset, and while it was too cloudy for good color, it was our first view of the Taj Mahal. What a view of the backside, and so much closer with a small river between. Having arrived in Agra around 3:30pm, was a great option for a couple hours.

title: Swear it's a secret
review: Here you are, practically standing along the river looking over at the throngs of visitors to the Taj Mahal.  Yet there are only a couple of people next to you, so there's plenty of privacy to take a couple more iconic pictures and explore the ruins of the would-have-been black Taj.  And I mean ruins, because it seems partially excavated then abandoned.  A real shame.  The land is owned by the state with a nice garden to walk through as well.  You will see near abject poverty on the drive over if you want a reminder of how good your life really is.  Which reminds you of security, because there's plenty of it in the park but no lights around for when sunset finally arrives.  Perhaps this slightly out of the way trip is what keeps this little gem in the shadow of one of the world's biggest.

title: Just another view
review: This is an ordinary park with just another view of the Taj Mahal from accross the river. It is peaceful and quiet once you there, but again you pay an inflated entry price and have to fight off touts and beggars to get in.

title: Nice view at Sunset
review: We watched the sunset at this park.  It was beautiful and worth the time to see the Taj from across the river.  We got some great pictures of the Taj with no one else in them.

title: Gardens of peace
review: Even if you only have time to wander around the gardens this attraction is well worth the time. See all sorts of creatures from monkeys, deer and peacocks serenely sunbathing inj the shadow of this amazing fort.

title: Not preserved well
review: The place has a great history behind it, but it was not preserved well.. Too bad, because seeing Taj Mahal on sunset from here is priceless! Mehtab Bagh (Moonlight Garden) is a charbagh complex that lies north of the Taj Mahal complex and the Agra Fort --on the opposite side of the Yamuna River. The garden complex, square in shape, measures about 300 by 300 metres and is perfectly aligned with the Taj Mahal on the opposite bank. During the rainy season, the ground becomes partially flooded. It is also noted that Emperor Shah Jahan had identified a site from the crescent-shaped, grass-covered floodplain across the Yamuna River as an ideal location for viewing the Taj Mahal. It was then created as "a moonlit pleasure garden called Mehtab Bagh."  Remaining structures within the garden were in a ruinous state. The garden's existence was almost forgotten and it had degraded to little more than an enormous mound of sand, covered with wild vegetation and alluvial silt.

title: Wonderful place for the alternate view of the Taj
review: Mehtab Bagh in agra should be on every  photographer's list. This bagh is actually a Mughal site where Shah Jehan put in a garden to admire his lovely Taj Mahal. Legends also tell us that the Mehtab Bagh was actually the site where Shah Jehan intended to build a black Taj mirroring the white one for himself. History had it otherwise. Shah Jehan's son Aurangzeb dethroned his father and imprisioned him and thus discarded the plans for the Black Taj. The father was hastily buried beside his beloved wife in the white taj and there is only a single Taj Mahal now.

title: Nice spot from the back of the Taj.
review: Nice spot from the back of the Taj. It is a black Taj site. Nice view of the sunset setting of the Taj.

title: Taj
review: Main attraction is an unobstructed view of the back of the Taj. Garden is pleasant for a stroll but sunset for the view is worth the 100 rupee admission.

title: Amazing Sunset Views on the Back Side of the Taj
review: Best time to visit is right before sunset. Its on the back side of the Taj across the river and you get some really killer photos from the back side around sunset or even sunrise will be a great time to go. Best time of the year will be ideally during monsoon as the the river is cleaner and has more water around that time which helps you get a much much better shot!!!

title: Very close view of the Taj
review: The 'moonlight' garden, a beautiful and green garden just opposite the river with a close view of the Taj. A much less crowded site to take photos of the Taj esp during sunset. Would recommend it if you have the time.

title: Good Bagh
review: This is huge garden where you can see Taj Mahal from far away. It is said that Shahjahan was about to construct a Black Taj Mahal at this place and the foundation for the same can be seen. However his son Aurangzeb arrested and stopped him from doing so since it was a very costly affair. There are lot of birds inside the park. We saw a kingfisher.

title: Don't stray by the riverside.
review: Be here at sunrise to catch a glimpse of the Taj without the rush. The fence is broken towards the riverside. DO NOT STRAY, cops shall push you back.

title: Ridiculous to pay in.
review: Basically use the 100R to pay towards a nice meal from one of the rooftop bars instead! Pretty much the same view but getting a full tummy out of it at the same time. A much better view for sunset would be from behind the east gate! If someone is clever enough to sort that out I would love to return....

title: Good place to view the Taj Mahal
review: On the river bank opposite the Taj Mahal it gives you a good uninterrupted view of the building without all the crowds.  Its a bit of a walk through gardens that on a sunny day are pleasant to walk in.  Near by are walks through a lightly wooded area.  We came here explicitly to look across the river at the Taj Mahal and were rewarded with beautiful views.

title: Great Taj Mahal views
review: If you forget about Taj Mahal, no special gardens. But ... the views of Taj Mahal especially at sunset, make this place special.

title: Great alternative view of the Taj Mahal
review: The only reason anyone would visit the gardens are the view across to the Taj Mahal.  The gardens themselves aren't worth seeing really,  they are well kept,  but offer nothing of note.

title: great view, minimal entrance fee
review: Our driver dropped us off and said it wasn't worth the entrance fee as there was a side road we could walk down to see the Taj at sunset. We tried the side road, but it wasn't straight on, and was at an angle, so we paid the very minimal entrance fee. The park is under major renovations, but the gardens are lovely to stroll through. The photos of the Taj were straight on and symmetrical, which was exactly what I wanted for a photograph. Park does close at sunset, so they "kick" everyone out around 6pm (november). We actually wished we had gotten there earlier to spend more time in the garden area. This last tip probably isn't too important to many, but worth mentioning. Since my 3 year old son was at home, I took his favorite toy to India and took photos of it each place we went. When we went into the Taj Mahal, they wouldn't let me take it in, and a Taj photo was the ONE shot I wanted while there. They held it at security and I picked it up on my way out. I was able to get THE shot I wanted from this park, which made me very happy.

title: The other side of Taj
review: Whenever you visit taj make it a point to reach Mehtab Bagh just before Sun Set. It's a look to be believed to be seen. The cl;lourful sky with Look of the Taj as if made of Molten Wax you can capture in your mind with everlasting memory

title: Sunset views
review: A great place to get your sunset shots of the taj! It was our first view of the taj and it was awesome!

title: Alternative View of Taj
review: If you are visiting Agra and Taj do not miss the view from mehtab bagh, North of taj on the other side of Yamuna it gives a unique view of taj. Specially if you enjoy photography you cannot give Mehtab Bagh a miss. It is under renovation but the gardens are very well maintained.

title: Wah Taj!
review: If you want awesome pictures of yours and your loved ones with the Taj Mahal in the backdrop; you needn't go any further than Mehtab Bagh! It also marks the foundation of the Black Taj....on a clear day, you would get a beautiful view of the Taj across the river Yamuna.

title: Time immemorial
review: You can imagine the luxury shah Jehan had, the Bagh im even today maintained well ,the view from the Bagh is awesome ,taj in its true glory

title: Wonderfull spot to see Taj Mahal (at sunset)
review: Be there a couple of ours before sunset. The moment of sunsetitself is a bit to late for the best light.

title: Great sunset treat
review: From the Taj Mahal itself, we took a tuk tuk to Mehtab Bagh which cost us 400Rs return trip, including driver wait time, back to our hotel near the Taj Mahal.

title: Quiet little place for photographing the Taj Mahal
review: A quite place across the Jamuna river to picture the beautiful Taj Mahal. There isn't much for me to do there after that. I was interested in the Taj Mahal, most locals there are interested in dating their companion.

title: Great views of Taj Mahal across the river
review: No crowds.  The former moonlight gardens.  Folklore has it the emperor planned to build a Black Tower to complement the Taj Mahal and have a silver bridge connect the two.  Unfortunately, his son took over the Government and imprisoned his father.

title: Must see before you visit Taj
review: Mehtab Bagh offers a breathtaking view of the Taj Mahal from across the river Yamuna. Visit the Bagh before you visit Taj Mahal to kick start your imagination and prime you before you see the monument itself.

title: Welcome To Mehtab Bagh
review: This is only one Place where you can See Taj Mahal from the River Side Folklore has it the emperor .the

title: Do visit This Place also
review: I also Wondered What is there on the other Side of the Taj and wanted to see that, so I took a Cab and went to the other side of the Taj,

title: Perfect tranquil view of Taj Mahal from afar
review: For 200 rupees you get access to the beautiful Moonlight Gardens of Agra with an iconic view of Taj Mahal. Walking about the gardens at dusk, just before closing time when the area is almost free of tourists, was probably the best experience of visiting Agra. Especially after the overwhelming, impressive and stressful visit to Taj Mahal. Be sure to roam around the garden after absorbing the nice view. Stay clear of the toilets though, they are hazardous!

title: historical place but not well maneaged
review: I was there t for a picnic with my friends ,the road to this place passes thru the slums and the U.P. government is not taking any intrest in promoting these monuments ,there is a a river yamuna between Taj Mahal and this mehtaab Bagh,but I am sorry to say that they can attract 5000 tourist per day and they are hardly getting 200 par day ,very sad

title: Good for an across the river view of Taj Mahal
review: This garden is strictly meant for a view of the Taj Mahal from across the Yamuna river. The garden in itself is neither beautiful nor houses shady trees. So, it won't be a good idea on a summer afternoon or any noon.

title: Great view of Taj Mahal from across the river
review: It cost 100 rupees for foreigners to enter the Mehtab Bagh. The gardens are well kept and quiet. You will get a great view of the sunset and the back of thecTaj Mahal from directly across the Yamuna River. Apparently in summer the sunset makes the Taj appear to change colour as the sun sets and colours the night sky around it. Unfortunately we were there in winter when the sky was more clouded / smoggy and the sun much further west so that the sunset caused little impact on the Taj. If it was full moon that would probably be a great effect after nightfall but you would need a torch to find your way back out I think. Even without the colour effects the sunset visit is an opportunity for one last look at this gorgeous building. Locals in the area will offer to have their photos taken and then ask for a donation. Have the good grace not to take the photo if you are not going to pay - these people probably earn less per month then we spend on a single meal. If you take their photo, pay up ok.  The  Mehtab Bagh also has a roped off area that includes foundation ruins. It's roped off to protect it from you, and for your safety, so stay out.

title: Only go at sunset
review: The gardens are nothing to write home about, but the sunset view across the river to the Taj Mahal is. Join the sky gazers standing on the wall as the sun goes down. Look for sunset mode on your camera and be early sunsets do not last long.

title: Beautiful gardens, spectacular view
review: I loved spending time in these beautiful and peaceful gardens with their dazzling view of the Taj. It's perfect for photo-ops, and also a wonderful way to experience the magic of the Taj in a more intimate environment.

title: The Most Beautiful Bagh (Gardens)
review: Mehtab Bagh  is basically a charbagh, which is located towards the north of the Taj Mahal complex. A Wonderful experience..!!

title: Good place to see Taj Mahal from a distance
review: Good view but not close enough to see Taj Mahal in details. Still a good stop to view overall view of Taj along with side building (Mosque and guest house).

title: Favorite View of the Taj
review: I loved the view here. If you come at a time besides sunrise or sunset, you'll be able to enjoy the beauty of the Taj almost in complete solitude.

title: View at taj mahal
review: Best view on the taj mahal you can find. The entrance is 100rp each. But if you follow the path you get a side view almost the same as the garden. We made the choice to pay for it. And it was worth it. We saw a great sunset. If you have a choice, see it the day before you go to the taj mahal. You have a better idea of the structure by then.

title: Garden for the black Taj
review: This si a place were Shajahan planned to built a Taj in Black marble. This place is just behind Taj Mahal accross Yamuna river. The garden here is well maintained, the view of Taj from this garden is awsome.

title: Panaroma of the taj
review: you should visit the mehtab bagh to get a panaroma view of the taj. the view from there is breathtaking.

title: Good view of Taj
review: If you want to take good pictures of the Taj with no crowds around, this garden is a must visit in the early hours. Reach by 7 am and take some fabulous pictures of the Taj with morning sun. Worth a visit for sure

title: Sunset view from Mehtab Bagh
review: The thing that impresses me about Mehtab Bagh is its other name which is "BLACK TAJ". The feeling of excitement that i had for  seeing the sunset view of the taj mahal from mehtab bagh faded away the moment we realized that we were late. Pls arrive at least at 0500PM to get the sun set view. From the ticket counter u have to walk for atleast 5 mins to reach the river bank.

title: Two TajMahal Experience..
review: This Place lets you experience two TajMahal Simultaneously...Amazing place to appreciate the beauty from a distance...

title: Mehtab bagh, Agra, India.
review: This is one place where you can see Taj from the other side of Yamuna river. It was here that one more structure in the lines of Taj Mahal was planned. You can see remains of the foundation here. It is directly opposite the Taj Mahal but takes half an hour to reach there. You must make sure you are there by five pm to get a view of Taj before the sun sets. It's nice to see the light from the setting sun fall on the structure. It is a nice photo point.

title: More about the imagination than anything else
review: this is a modern garden grown in place of the original Mehtab Bagh and at the time of our visit was in very poor condition. But this is a place that you could sit at ease and look at the Taj..far from the maddening crowd!

title: Not really worth it
review: To get the back view of the Taj from across the Yamuna river you can visit the Mehtab Bagh.  The roads that lead to this garden is small and terrible.  If all you want to see if the backside view of Taj then you don't need to go inside this garden, just walk to the end of the street that runs along the perimeter of this  garden and you get a beautiful view of the Taj for free.

title: Another view of Taj Mahal
review: Here is a nice place to escape crowd from Taj Mahal. The park contains lots of colorful flowers and tree with large shades. You can watch Taj Mahal as long as you wish privately from anywhere in the park. There is ruin of the dark Taj Mahal remaining here.

title: Must Visit @ dusk to see the Taj from a little distance
review: This Place is a must visit during dusk to see the Taj Mahal. Its a sprawling nice Garden and i am sure one would love to spend his time during the stay in Agra.

title: View Taj with difference
review: it is a place to view Taj with difference.

title: Good views over Taj
review: Some quiet gardens offering excellent views of the Taj Mahal from across the river. Worth a visit sunrise or sunset if you have the time when in Agra.

title: Nothing great
review: Nothing much to see the only attraction that this place gives you beautiful view of Taj from backside, That alone is worth going to this place. Apart from that nothing much it was set up by Mughals at a times Just in front of the Park towards taj you could see the foundation of the the Black Taj that Shah Jahan wanted to make for himself.

title: Stunning evening views of the Taj Mahal
review: Great spot across the river from the Taj Mahal with wonderful photo opportunities at every turn. Beautiful gardens which are well maintained. Locals selling refreshments at the gate, a decent toilet and a relaxed atmosphere.

title: Serene view of Agra
review: We get a serene rear view of the Taj along the banks of Yamuna. The atmosphere is peaceful, tranquil and romantic.

title: Garden view of Taj
review: This is worth a visit to simply take in a different perspective of the beautiful Taj Mahal. Best in the cooler months - avoid in summer when temperatures soar over 40C+. A lovely setting, and would be very picturesque at sunset.

title: Dawn view of the Taj
review: While I had visited the Taj Mahal twice before, this was the first time I had seen it from Mehtab Bagh and at dawn.   Lovely light and worth the trip across the river.

title: For the best Taj view
review: We can't recommend Mehtab Bagh, or moonlight garden, highly enough, not for the garden itself but for the amazing view of the Taj across the other side of the river. It's at Nagla Devjit and is a must see location for us. We strongly recommend arriving the day before your visit to the main Taj site and dependant upon how much time you have in Agra you could head here upon your arrival or after the Taj gets really busy in the afternoon as the view is best in late afternoon/early evening. There's not much else to see in the rose garden but the view of the Taj is fantastic. The entrance is here - http://goo.gl/maps/dJ6Ja

title: Best way to get your first close up of the Taj
review: We came here during sunset and it was really quiet. We were able to sit and relax while taking in the incredible views of the Taj. It's really nice to get a different view of it.

title: A different view of the Taj Mahal
review: Our flight landed late in the afternoon and we drove from the airport to Mehtab Bagh for a late afternoon view of the Taj. Mahal.  The view from across the river in the soft light gives you a different perspective of the monument.   I am not sure the effect would be the same at any other time of day.

title: extraordinary view on taj mahal along with a peaceful garden
review: a must visit in evening times,we could enjoy the real beauty of taj mahal during sunset sitting inside garden with literally no obstacles to vie taj.

title: Beautifull garden
review: Beautifull garden, and especially the view for Taj Mahal in the sunset was really interesting and fascinating. Definitely go in the evening time, when the sun is going down.

title: Peaceful view of Taj Mahal
review: One can skip the stampede visit to Taj Mahal and visit Mehtab Bagh. This place offers the magical view of The Taj where one can peacefully enjoy just the beauty of Taj Mahal. Also, Mehtab Bagh has the foundation of the "Black Taj Mahal" which could never built.

title: The Moonlight Garden on the Yamuna River
review: The Moonlight Garden is a perfect spot to view the Taj Mahal at sunset.  The park and gardens lie directly across from the Yamuna River from the Taj and are in reasonably good condition.  Once you take your photographs of the Taj Mahal, it's nice to stroll around to enjoy the gardens.

title: Good view of Taj in a peaceful setting
review: It's a good place with a low fee (100 INR at the time this was written) to see Taj Mahal without all the tourist and hawkers on your back. You can easily hang around and relax, which won't be that easy in other parts of Agra.

title: Peaceful and beautiful
review: Our guide brought us here for a sunset viewing of the Taj Mahal. What a wonderful first view of the Taj. The garden was beautiful and very peaceful,  no hawkers inside so you could just absorb the beauty and peacefulness of this experience. Go there!

title: Underwhelming
review: We were led to believe these were magnificent, but they are not particularly spectacular and you have to pay to get in as well as hire a tuktuk to get there which probably isn't worth it. We combined it with a visit to the mini Taj which wasn't too bad, but if you only have a couple of days in Agra go and see the Taj Mahal properly and Agra Fort is good. These gardens combined with the mini Taj are OK if you are trying to fill another day.

title: Best place to watch the sunset over the Taj Mahal.
review: We went in early March so the flowers were already blooming and the garden was a sight to behold. After taking what seems like hundreds of photos we sat down and watched the sunset over the Taj. You can see the color of the Taj slightly changes as the sun sets. A great place to sit and get an undisturbed view of the Taj Mahal.

title: Nice Park for Additional Taj Views
review: This park is a bit out of the way - you will need a driver or tuk tuk to get there, but it does offer some nice views of the Taj from the other side of the river.  We were there in the afternoon but I imagine it would be a great place to watch the sunset over the Taj.

title: Wonderful
review: We arrived late afternoon and the soft light in the beautiful Taj Mahal over the river was less white and more pink.  The riverside is accessed through a lovely garden.  There were about a hundred people sitting quietly enjoying the view.

title: good views of Taj Mahal
review: There are good views of Taj Mahal and river from these gardens however there was not much to see in actual gardens when we visited in Februay .

title: Best view of taj from this side.
review: Best view of taj from this side. Huge garden in this arid city comes as surprise. Maintenance by government agencies could have been better.

title: Stunning View of the Taj
review: What could be better than sitting in a beautiful, peaceful park, looking over the Yamuna River at the Taj Mahal! Spent an hour or two here just marvelling at the magnificence. Offers a superb view of the Taj without the crowd. Definitely worth stopping by whilst in Agra, sit on the wall on the river bank and relax!

title: Another view for Taj Mahal !!!
review: Right across the river from the Taj Mahal lies this garden. We visited during the winter so nothing was blooming but there wasn't the maddenning crowds like there are at the Taj.

title: Panormic view of Taj
review: This  park just opposite to Taj Mahal across Yamuna river gives magnificent view of the Taj Mahal looking over the Yamuna. Some movies also have been shot here. You can not expect the grand park here but grand view of Taj for sure that too avoiding big crowd. we really enjoyed the view.

title: Good place to view the Taj
review: Mehtab Bagh on the opposite side of the river Yamuna is a beautiful place to view the Taj. The gardens are neat and one of the tidiest places we saw in Agra it cost Rs 100 each.

title: Nice place
review: he marble dome that surmounts the tomb is the most spectacular feature. Its height of around 35 metres (115 ft) is about the same as the length of the base, and is accentuated as it sits on a cylindrical "drum" which is roughly 7 metres (23 ft) high. Because of its shape, the dome is often called an onion dome or amrud (guava dome). The top is decorated with a lotus design, which also serves to accentuate its height.

title: View of Taj across the Yamuna river
review: This place gives you the nice view of Taj mahal across the Yamuna river. When you are approaching it, You can have a look on the Taj mahal on your right side.

title: Maybe skip it
review: I just don't get all the rave reviews. The garden didn't look like much when I went, though maybe February isn't the best time to visit. The view of the Taj is ok, but you get just as nice a view from the Red Fort. The ticked vendor tried to cheat me by giving me a used ticket. The guard checking the tickets tried the same and I had to insist for him to tear the ticket and give me the stub. If you do go, make sure you do the same - this way the money goes to the Indian government and they use it to maintain the monuments.

title: The Moonlight Garden: Liking the views of the TM as the sun went down..
review: Most people do this. Visit the Mahtab Bagh Gardens which are very pretty, and then head over to the River bank and see the Taj Mahal from the other side. You could see people walking around and then realised how small they were in terms of scale. Very romantic if you are that way inclined… I am fortunate to look at beauty every day of my life in the form of my lady wife… the TM a close second.

title: Not worth visit
review: Just visited this park. Good views of the Taj Mahal but park is not worth going to. Save your rupees as it's a disappoinment. Also I think they do a ticket scam same reason as previous review. Similar thing happened to us. Paid our tour guide money to get tickets, went to the park for about 15 minutes as we were leaving tour guide got money from ticket box (on the sly). We will be letting the tour company know about this.

title: experience the taj without crowd
review: This is only place from where you can see the whole veiw of Taj. The best time to go over here after 4 pm. The tkt is Rs 110. and if you have Tajmahal sameday tkt then you will get discount of rs 10. Sunset looks beautiful from here.

title: Serene and nice setting amidst trashy surrounds
review: Likes: A nice view of the Taj Mahal from across the river and in a nice quite garden setting.  Just stay away from the river - which has lots of ufo (unidentified floating objects).

title: Banks of Yamuna River
review: Located at the banks of Yamuna, this is the place where you want to be. Specially for local Aagaraites, many of them who in spite of living in Agra for their lives never visit such places cause being far from the city. These places are still kind of untouched from the pollution, crowd etc. One can peacefully sit at the bank of Yamuna river on lush green grass, in a beautiful trees & flowers surrounded environment. I've spent some quality time there.

title: Wow Taj!!!
review: Want to be far from the maddening crowd to have a peaceful view of Taj, well this is the place. Just across river, on the other bank of Yamuna is this garden, that has a excellent view of backside of Taj. Not many appreciate this garden, so the crowd is meager. There are few planks facing the Taj, would not be a bad idea to spend some time here and see Taj reflects different shades based on the time of the day. Though this places sports less of a garden in winter, it is worth spending time here for the mesmerizing view of Taj.

title: Wonderful view of Taj Mahal
review: This is a lovely to spot to go in the evening to watch the sunset over the Taj Mahal.  You get an uninterrupted view of this magical monument and it is far less crowded than the being at the Taj itself.  The gardens are also in reasonable condition and worth strolling around if you have time.

title: Gives you another angle to view the Taj Mahal
review: Right across the river from the Taj Mahal lies this garden. We visited during the winter so nothing was blooming but there wasn't the maddenning crowds like there are at the Taj.

title: Best view of Taj
review: Go during the day (or moonlit night with special permission- gates close at 6.00 pm) to have a good view of Taj from here. Spread over a huge area on the banks of Yamuna. The name itself means moon or moonlight.

title: sad state
review: so much can be done withn this garden that adjoins the marvellous Taj, but very poorly maintained. even the stream is full of filth

title: Best way to enjoy Taj Mahal view
review: A beautiful garden! It is right across the Taj from the river, so the view is epic, to say the least. The price is also about 1/3 (or 1/5, dun remember precisely) that of the Taj. Furthermore, since you are not right in front of the building, you can fully appreciate how the sun changes the marble color. At sunset, one side of Taj Mahal would be pink while the other turn very slight bluish. Extremely pretty.

title: Great view of the Taj from across the river!!
review: A nice way to end your day in Agra. The place was not really crowded in the early evening. It is the perfect place to stay for the sunset as one gets to see the Taj in a different light.

title: Beautiful gardens with an outstanding view of the Taj Mahal
review: From these gardens the view of the Taj Mahal accross the Yamuna in the evening is outstanding. Well worth the visit.

title: perfect place to see the Taj
review: on the opposite bank of the yamuna...The Whole view of the TAJ Complex....Perfect place to sit n be lost in the eternal beauty of the TAJ

title: Wonderful place to visit while you are in Agra...
review: Mehtab Bagh is a beautiful place to visit not because of its beauty but to view Taj Mahal. Taj Mahal looks beautiful from Mehtab Bagh. Though so beautiful it took us 24 years to actually visit it.

title: Good view of TajMahal from other side of river Yamuna
review: We have visited the Garden in the afternoon to see the TajMahal and liked the view from other side of the river. The garden needs some maintenance.

title: Beautiful place to see the Taj from
review: Mehtab Bagh is on the opposite side of the river Yamuna. Its a beautiful place to get great views of the Taj from.

title: Best View of Taj Mahal
review: If you are looking to glance at Taj Mahal for long without being disturbed by the rush of tourists, then this place is the best. Its not so well kept park with buffaloes roaming around but if you love photography and want to see taj from the riverbank than you have to be here. Visit here around sunset and see Taj Changing colors.

title: Excelent Taj view at the banks of Yamuna
review: Just opposite to Taj, actually provides the backside view of Taj Mahal from the gardens. Good to go in winters when flowers are planted and cool brezes blow.  Nice place to relax and enjoy the Taj view.

title: ENGLISH GARDEN
review: An English style Mughal Built garden, which makes u feel out of this world. It consists of Trees, variety of flowers, fountains and a magnificent view of the great TAJ MAHAL.

title: MEHTAB BAGH A NICE VIEW OF TAJ
review: one can get a nice view of taj from mehtab bagh. especially if u found taj closed in friday u can visit mehtab bagh from where u can get a full view of taj.

title: Hidden gem
review: Can one have enough of the Taj?

title: Not as good as expected
review: In the middle of a dirty village, unfriendly staff at entrance.  For some unexplicable reason tripds not allowed.  Garden uninteresting, but I came for the view of the Taj Mahal.  The view was ok, but there is almost no water in the Yamuna River so no reflection in foreground, just dirt.  There is barbed wire so you cannot go down to the river.  An unfriendly guard ran around with a whistle at sunset, chasing us out from the grounds like we were cows or sheep :-(  I would highly recommend sunrise at the Taj Mahal instead of this.

title: Reasonable View of the Taj
review: The only real reason to go to Mehtab Bagh is to view the Taj Mahal. I thought the view was quite average and what I saw of the garden, it also had average maintenance. If you walk down the road that the entrance to the garden is on, you will get to the river. I was even able to walk along in front of the garden and even enter it. I didn't have to pay the fee and got the same view of the Taj Mahal as everyone else. I would definitely recommend doing this if you are going to Mehtab Bagh. Who wants to pay to walk around a garden anyway?

title: Nice to wander around for an hour or two
review: Came by the day before going to the Taj so we had our first very lovely glimpse from here.

title: bonus view of the taj mahal
review: Ideal place to be in during sunset away from all the din and the crowds. One can breathe in the beauty and grandeur of the the Taj Mahal in absolute peace and serenity for a long long time till it gets dark.

title: visit for breathtaking view of taj mahal
review: mostly travelers do not visit this place, but you should visit this place to get an awesome, breathtaking view of TAJ. This place as such has nothing much to see, but view of TAJ and pictures of TAJ you will get from this place have no comparison.

title: A lovely place for a stroll and a view
review: How lovely to end the day here, looking at the back of the Taj and enjoying the gardens.  A restful place away from the hub-bub of typical Indian towns and not a hawker in sight.

title: Must visit for sunset view of Taj Mahal
review: It is the best place for the sunset view of Taj. At the same time it is a good place for photography.

title: Wow!!!
review: Went there just like that, but the view of the Taj Mahal took us by surprise. There are no proper roads to visit this place. Also there is no proper parking. Even the garden is not in a great shape. But the view of Taj compensates for all the hardships we took to reach this place. Excellent pics.

title: BEST VIEW OF TAJ!
review: The park itself is lovely, but seems to be under some sort of upgrading - Hardly any visitors here, so it was very  quiet, but lots of birds & nature around. you must visit this to see the Taj Mahal, from a different perspective. Breathtaking.

title: The Garden
review: The place from where we can see the taj during sunset. Beautiful view of taj during sunset. The reflection of taj in the river during sunset is simply amazing

title: Nice view on Taj Mahal
review: This is a great spot where to relax after a tiring day - watching Taj Mahal from across the river. Especially good it is during the sunset when the sun tones the big, white dome in various colors. Unfortunately, closer to the river there are a lot of rubble. Nevertheless, it is a peaceful, quiet place, which are generally hard to find around the noisy and polluted Indian cities.

title: Full view of the Taj Mahal, the temple and guest accommodation
review: From here you can get a full view of the Taj and the adjoining buildings.  You cannot get full uninterrupted views from the Taj grounds. It was very quiet when I went on a Sunday afternoon. It was a brilliant view. Spray before you go, some mozzies about.

title: Different view for the Taj Mahal.
review: Not so clouded place to see the Taj Mahal in the other side.

title: Just visit "The Taj"
review: It looks like in a single piece of marble. which is worth visiting at least once in life.. Because pictures or TV can not describe the beauty of Tajmahal..Unless you visit Tajmahl you can imagine wonderful it is? when you have a first glimpse, you will just say "wow".. So just make a plan to visit Tajmahal as soon as possible..Other wise time is passing so fast..

title: TAJ MAHAL BACK SIDE PIC
review: there is nice view of taj and very beautiful garden and lot of flower and very quite place nice to see in sunset view

title: See the Taj Mahal at Sunset
review: Mehtab Bagh is the best place to see the Taj Mahal at the time of sunset. This is quite place. One can sit there and enjoy the changing colours of the Taj Mahal as the sun goes down. The garden is very beautiful.

title: Just a Shabby Garden
review: Not too interesting.An unfinished grave thats all.Betterto spend that time exploring the Fort.Or visit Fatehpur Sikri.

title: Excellent View
review: Mehtab Bagh is also known as Moonlight Garden and is located at Charbagh. It has a riverfront terrace with an octagonal pool in the center. There were 4 sandstone towers one on each corner of the garden. Due to destruction's, only one remains at present on the south eastern side. The 2 garden pavilions are situated on the north and south of the large pool. The north side of the garden has a square with a square pool in its center.

title: Mehtab Bagh
review: We went to the pensive garden of Mehtab Bagh or “Moonlight Garden” (“Mehtab” meaning moonlight, “Bagh” meaning “garden”), across the river from the Taj Mahal, which gives a contemplative view of the great monument. It is divided into quadrants each of which contains various plants from the Mughal era. In the center is a fountain which produces a mist through which one can view the Taj. There are several families sitting around. One of the kids, seeing we are tourists, asks us for money (No!). Near the river are the remains of some structure, a pond/pool, along with a small wall covered with barbed wire along which Indian soldiers patrol but let us take photos of the Taj.

title: Brilliant views
review: Visit this place in the evening to experience the best views of the aTaj Mahal. The garden is very average and not really maintained but the location of the garden makes it a must visit place. Check the timings before you go as it closed down in late evening.

title: A great alternative uncrowded view of the Taj
review: I headed here on the day that the Taj is closed (Friday) and was amazed to be one of 10 tourists here.  This is a lovely peaceful site to view the Taj from.  Highly recommended

title: Good view of Taj
review: This place is just an average place for a garden. But excellent place to catch a great view of the Taj Mahal.

title: Garden with the best view in the world!
review: Go here before you go to the Taj and place will takeover your senses!! if i say anymore.. i ll take away the spirit and the surprise on offer!

title: Good Views of the Taj Mahal
review: This is a small park with a nominal charge which is situated opposite the Taj Mahal on the other side of the Yamuna River. I would recommend taking a rickshaw to visit. There is not much to the park itself but it does offer an alternative view of the Taj Mahal.

title: Mini Taj....
review: Really nice surprise at how beautiful this place is, definitely worth visiting for an hour or so. Look out for the hop on hop off bus to visit lots of great spots of interests, cost and time effectively.

title: The best view of the Taj Mahal
review: Stand here on the banks of the Yamuna River as the sun sets on the Taj Mahal opposite. It's just the best view!

title: Rear view of taj mahal
review: Best palce to relax and enjoy a view of the taj mahal which is just across the river.

title: Nice and Different view of Taj mahal
review: Not much people go there, But this bagh or garden gives very very good view of taj mahal.

title: Agra - Mehtab Bagh - You now pay to stand on the other side of the river.
review: We wouldn't have missed seeing the sunset from the banks of the river opposite the Taj Mahal but as the sun doesn't really set over or behind the Taj Mahal, having to pay to stand on a river bank is really milking the Taj Mahal itself for all it is worth. The site of the changing colours of the Taj Mahal as the sun goes down is excellent and it was really calm and beautiful to view from across the river but something still sticks in that we had to pay 100 INR. It's not the amount but the fact the authorities seem to charge for a view, not a visit but a view. It must be me. Still we had a great time and it is worth the money to visit this spot so please forget my little whinge. Don't expect any specific standing area or seats etc, only a river bank to stand on a view this spectacular monument. Well worth a visit.

title: Dilapidated garden offering the best view of the Taj
review: Babur's garden across the Yamuna is in a terribly neglected shape. But fortunately, it offers the best view of the Taj Mahal with the Yamuna river flowing in the foreground. It's away from the crowds and clutter and the painfully long queus at the main venue. The black plinth of the supposed site of Shah Jahan's own tomb can also be seen there but that is controversial.

title: One of the best place to see Taj Mahal with river in front
review: I went just before Sunset, to see the color change of Taj Mahal. Apparently, I enjoyed the view of Taj even when there was ample of light. The view of Yamuna river and Mahal across the river are just magnificent. The sunset was not so great as I was expecting. The park (bagh) has a lot of greenery and adds a great atmosphere. One can walk around, sit very close to the banks of the river and stare at Taj Mahal.

title: Amazing View of Taj
review: Definitely a must see when in Agra. Go at sunset - its beautiful and amazing and you get some great photos from a different angle. If you can't afford to go to the Taj Mahal then its also a much cheaper option.

title: Different side for Viewing Tajmahal
review: Mehtab Bagh- "The Moon Light Garden" was originally laid by Mughal king Babur. This is more known as the foundation of Black Tajmahal, which according to Historians is a Myth.

title: Quite place to see the Taj
review: I allways recommend this place to visit at the time of sunset or before that. It is very different view of Taj from this side of the river and moreover here nobody to disturb you or distract you. You can quitely sit here in one corner or on the grass or on the wall. It is sad that river most of the time is low. But during floods Taj looks more beautifull with reflection of it in river Yamuna.

title: We can see the amazing sunset and meaningful Taj Mahal from this place on a clear day.
review: I considered the Emperor's grief further, seeing Taj Mahal from here. So, I respectfully took a photograph. A pose is a bridge between Taj Mahal and Black Taj. I sincerely respect the Emperor and Empress.

title: I'm glad we went
review: We got here just before 10am.  The best place to view the Taj from across the river without being jostled by crowds.  We enjoyed walking under the fruit trees.

title: Nice views of Taj from here
review: The best view of Taj Mahal from across the Yamuna river and without the crowd! We went there to see the sunrise. Apparently The Taj Mahal's reflection in the water at sunrise looks like a floating tomb. Unfortunately it was a cloudy day . Never the less, it is a perfect place to get some great photos and do check out the garden there.

title: Sunset
review: this place is amazing if you like to take pictures, i have been there at sunset amazing view of taj mahal, i have taken lots and lots of pictures

title: Good
review: Good to see , it is ok and but good to see at sunset , back side of Taj Mahal from Mehtab bagh looks awsomse .

title: Best Taj view
review: Personally, I found that this site has better of the Taj than from inside the grounds. Maybe because there were few people the times I went (whereas the Taj grounds are crowded). Go for sunset. In this tranquil place, you can enjoy the view of the flowers and trees and the sounds of birds while admiring the Taj -what more to ask for...

title: Only if you don't want to visit the Taj itself
review: Yes, you get a good view of the Taj from across the river, but it's not really worth the effort to get there if you've already visited the Taj itself. You'll also need a good zoom lens if you want quality pics.

title: go there with a good rickshaw driver
review: you now have to pay to enter the gardens.

title: Great view
review: A good option if your in Agra on a friday when the Taj Mahal is closed.  You get great views of the monument and its much less crowded.

title: just average ..one may skip this
review: It offers a back-side view of the TajMahal. That is the only attraction. The garden itself is not maintained very well.

title: the best place to see the Taj mahal
review: you must go to Mehtab Bagh ..There is old remnant which is believed to be black Taj. There is good garden maintained well …you must wait for sunset to see the color of Taj changing…

title: Really excellent
review: Must visit on the trip to Agra. Great view of the Taj and beautiful to watch the sun setting over the Taj and it changing colors. Best time to visit is around sunrise or sunset

title: Sensational views of the TAJ
review: The Mehtab Bagh provides sensational views of the TAJ Mahal as it is in straight alignment to the TAJ. Apart from plent of fruits it is well spread out and the Mughals planted fruits here to replicate their Afghanistan days. But the view is super.

title: Good View of Taj Mahal
review: If you only want to take a picture of Taj Mahal, the tips is you no need to go inside to the park, just walk down to the river side and its free. You wil see the whole Taj Mahal

title: A must for photographers
review: This is the place to see the Taj from across the river at sunset, so it's worth a visit for serious photographers and people who don't want to pay so much to see the Taj up close. It's also visible at a further distance from Agra Fort.

title: Mehtab Bagh
review: Visit to Mehtab Bagh in the evening is a must for any Taj lover, as the sun sets behind it, the day time marble white Taj turns into black silhouette with deep orange sky, a sight not to be missed and captured on camera.

title: Another great view of Tajmahal
review: Awesome view! A beautiful garden specially the Guava orchard, has a great view of the Taj Mahal, cut across-ed by the filthy, so called river Yamuna, now look like a drain here. But one get a great picture, even the reflection in the filthy river looks great. For those who are more romantic they can just sit down here and watch the great monument, The sign of Love !

title: worth the effort
review: Yes the gardens are not exceptional but the views are especially if you want the full Taj experience and some great photo opportunities. We took a chai stop near the entrance and spent a pleasant hal hour chatting to the locals who were very friendly.

title: Peaceful Taj!
review: Well if you have already visited Taj Mahal once and want to avoid the crowd the next time, you should definitely visit Mehtab Bagh!

title: Average Park
review: It is an average park but it is directly across the river from the Taj and a wonderful place to take great photos especially with some of the flowering plants.  The park itself could be nicer and since you pay to get into this park it should be better.

title: Exactly opposite Taj Mahal on other side of Yamuna
review: This place is a must visit, one can see Taj Mahal from across the river from here with its reflection in the waters of the river. Also, there is foundation of a Black Taj Mahal here. This building was never completed though. Also, enjoy the garden with its vegetation and exotic birds around.

title: Can't miss it!
review: Best place in Agra to watch the sunset. I proposed here!

title: Pretty garden, but view available for free
review: The garden is pretty, and there are some rock walls to sit on, but you can see the same view of the Taj Mahal for free if you continue down the road that the entrance is on (towards the Taj).  We unfortunately did not learn this until after we were in.

title: it was the best
review: After taj and fort it was really tired and then it came the mehatab bagh

title: Beautiful, must visit...
review: In it's own way this place is as beautiful and special as it's "big brother" Taj Mahal. Well worth a visit.

title: Breathtaking!
review: now, this came a surpise!!! never knew about this site across the river and the brathtaking view that it has to offer, i've told that be it sunrise or sunset, the site has a great view of Taj, i liked it more than the regular view.

title: Took my breath away
review: We happened to notice a lot of (camera) flashes going off from across the river while we were at the Taj Mahal, so we decided to figure out where this location was. Found this place after a bit of asking around..The garden itself seemed to be "under construction", what with a number of gardeners busying themselves with landscaping. We went there after a rainy night and had to wade through a very swampy area to reach the view point.

title: Wonderful view
review: The garden itself is a little over rated. However, the view is exceptional and I highly recommend this at sunset.

title: Quiet Monument
review: This peaceful monument is well worth a visit, it isn't exactly the Taj and it doesn't attract the same number of visitors but its still a beautiful building to walk around although you'll need a torch to see some of the best ceiling work.

title: Romantic garden
review: The Mehtab Bagh, translated as Moonlight Garden, is a beautiful park located to the north of the Taj Mahal, across Yamuna River.

title: MOON LIGHT GARDEN
review: This is beautiful garden from where i saw the real beauty of taj, no crowd only peace and in peace i could search the peace. I was with a group of 15 tourist from Canada. And all were flattered after seeing the taj from mehtab garden

title: Best photo spot in the evening
review: You have come this far to see the Taj Mahal so why not see it from across the river with a completely unrestricted view of the Taj from a different angle? Evening was lovely with the Taj changing colour as the sun stared setting. Not crowded at all and a very peaceful garden to sit in and just take it all in with great views - go there!!

title: No one but you and the Taj...
review: When everyone is in the Taj Mahal, go the Mehtab Bagh where you will enjoy a beautiful setting for all the pictures you want since the Taj Mahal is across the river. I recommend you to go there either early in the morning or right before you go to the Taj.

title: Great view of the Taj at a fraction of the cost
review: We visited Mehtab Bagh first thing in the morning. We visited the Taj Mahal the day before and got some great photo's as the sun was setting, but we wanted to get some sunrise photos too. There was one group of local women and children enjoying an early morning picnic, and we met a wonderful couple from another state who were there on holiday.

title: garden
review: It's worth visiting this area for a nice walk and to see the Taj from a different angle.very beautifull garden, and very nice view you can relax there also

title: sunset
review: if you like to take pictures please go to this point when there is sunset, amazing view and you can take picture when sun is setting down there is redness in sky, though river is very dirty ;P

title: just some place to see different view of taj
review: the park was ok, but for 100 rs entry I expect a bit more than just a few plants and a fence around. You cannot get to the river either, just another tourist spot where they sell you some drinks and you can do your photo -.-

title: Visit only if you have nothing to do
review: The Mehtaab Bag is a very ordinary park. The only saving grace of this place is its proximity to the Taj. You get some really good angles to click the Taj Mahal but then, that is it.

title: A view of the Taj with no one to interrupt that view.
review: A few have advised to see this if you have nothing to do and I disagree.  It's not the gardens that you visit but the view of the Taj from the other side of the river.  This was a wonderful place to see the Taj and the bonus was that there were about 5 other people around.

title: Taj mahal Sunset @ Mehtab Bagh
review: Many travellers said Mehtab Bagh is the best place to see Taj mahal sunset, but after I went there, I found the sun and the building seems far apart, don't know whether it's a season's matter or what. for us if we don't have a wide len, I don't think we can capture a picture with both the sunset & the building in one shot.

title: Romance Bollywood style!
review: Beautiful garden across the Yamuna river with mesmerizing views of the Taj Mahal

title: An OK Site to see the Taj (on a clear day)
review: It's worth visiting this area for a nice walk and to see the Taj from a different angle.

title: Lovely garden and Taj viewpoint
review: This "moon garden" was built along the Yamuna opposite the Taj as a viewing point for the magnificent building.  The most popular time to visit is sunset. It's not too crowded and the small gardens are nice themselves. Definitely end your day in Agra here watching the rays of the setting sun illuminate the Taj.

title: Best place for Photo of Taj Mahal.
review: Mehtab Gaden is the best place to take photo of Taj mahal. it is my own experience. Taj mahal  looks more elevated from here. it has a complete look of (Guest House.left side)...Taj mahal (center)..Mosque(right hand side) ...it is another good idea to visit Taj mahal from here at the time of sunset without paying expensive ticket..This place is more peaceful..it is really nice when river is full.This place is something which you should experience it, it is really difficult to describe in words..This Garden has many tress and plants and has a very nice grass in it , like a carpet. This is like a place where you can feel the love among Shajahan (King ) and Mumtaz mahal (Queen) of Taj mahal.

title: Evening walk
review: you should visit this place in evening, it was a beautifull view , amazing, i clicked many pics of taj from there ,i feel relax visting this garden

title: Nice views of the Taj Mahal
review: To see the Taj Mahal from across the river, this is a peaceful park to visit.  There are armed guards however, that prevent visitors from wandering on the riverbank.  There are some lovely gardens here, but the main interest is seeing the Taj across the water.

title: park
review: be sure to get there before the sun sets. The park offers the opportunity to enjoy the taj mahal in complete relaxation without the crowds of groups that crowd the basement at all hours, you will find yourself among the fans of a few close friends of the wonders of the world. you can lay on the grass or down to the banks and head right for another angle

title: Cool
review: You can actually imagine Emperor Akbar taking a stroll here in the evening, awesome actually !

title: The bagh with the view
review: The reason for going to this moon garden was simply to have unobstructed view of the Taj. And yes, you get it totally! Will suggest to have a sunset excursion, worth the effort.

title: beautiful garden, the way to enjoy Taj Mahal with no crowd around you
review: I like the scenery and its nat to much tourist as in Taj mahal, but you still enjoy the view of Taj Mahal

title: Sunset point!
review: Go here for sunset views of the Taj Mahal. Walk to the front of the garden, then to the far left where there's a small rampart.

title: Nice view of the Taj from the other side of the river
review: Nice view of the Taj from the other side of the river, but the park itself was a bit scruffy.

title: Islamic garden with views
review: Our tuk tuk driver took us to this place, to see the Taj from the other side of the river.  To be quite honest skip this place and ask the driver to take you to where the locals live and to a slip road that leads you down to the river.  Infact just as good,  after talking to people visiting there, we all thought it was better.

title: Quite place.  Nice view of the Taj
review: This is a quite, shady garden area across the river from the Taj.  Nice stop after a hectic day.  Good view of the back of the Taj.

title: Ticket Scam
review: The park is what it claims to be - a quiet place to view the Taj Mahal, and best at sunset.  But if you have already spent the day staring at the Taj, then save your rupees and skip this park.

title: Great place to see the Taj from the other side of the river
review: The gardens are an excellent place to view the Taj Mahal in the comfort of lovely gardens.  The Mehtab Bagh was constructed by Shah Jahan so he could view the Taj in relative peace in beautiful surrounds and you can too.

title: Taj across the Yumuna!
review: Get an auto [tuk-tuk], bargain the price for a return trip & enjoy the Taj from across the river espicially at sunset!   The gardens had an entrance fee but did not look all that good.  Just walk down to the river's edge & gaze at the Taj!

title: sun set
review: it was awesome site to see sunset , it was very beautiful garden you can relax can see taj, click pictures and enjoy it was near by baby taj

title: Different view of the Taj Mahal
review: Worth a visit to these gardens which are located across the Jamunna River from the Taj Mahal.  The garden was built so that Shah Jahan could relax in the cool of the evening and enjoy the view across the river and the reflection of the garden's octagonal pool - this unfortunately is no longer there but if you use your imagination!

title: The Moon Garden
review: This Garden on the other side of the river gives the Taj Mahal a Grand Look it adds a Spellbound Charm to the beauty of it. The feeling it gives is beyond description. To enjoy that Feel one has to be there

title: Shame turned into all about $$
review: Yes it's a nice garden, if lucky a clear day good view of Taj Mahal,  with there high fenced in area,  now blocked off free river walk as well no boats alowed or walking along the river far side.  Hevan for bid we see the Taj Mahal with out paying a fee but also 28x higher fee for non national. Met many young poor budget travler who needed to chose to break there budget or go see it,  shame world coming all over high fences so we can't see historical things what next build wall around the Coliseum of Rome the Golden Gate Bridge. Sad world were become..!  Lucky for me came years ago it was free & not so much around..!  Now just another tourist trap that's over rated..!  So many other nice Temple, Tumb & Mosque  here India..  Even the park next to Taj Now has a fee..?

title: Sunset trip
review: We stopped here right at sunset at the end of a long day in Agra. It was our first view of the Taj and it was really amazing.

title: Great view of the Taj
review: This is park with a "Mughal-style" garden located across the river from the Taj Mahal.  It costs Rs 100 to enter but you can walk down to the river and have a clear view of the back of the Taj. It's a nice quiet place to visit.

title: Overpriced!
review: One has to pay 300 roepies to walk in a poorly kept 'park' with barely a few flowers and fences everywhere (around archeological? works) that make it difficult to reach the only reason to come here: the magnificent view of the Taj Mahal.

title: See the Taj from across the Yamuna River
review: Difficult to get to. Alot of traffic, but the gardens are nice. People go here to view the Taj at evening time, if they visited the Taj for sunrise, or during the day.

title: Uncrowded garden with views of the Taj Mahal
review: There really isn’t much to this garden. However, it wasn’t crowded at all when we were there and had nice views of the Taj Mahal across the river. The pollution was terrible, so the views were very hazy. Still, probably worth the small admission fee to be able to see it with few people in your way.

title: Great place in lovely area
review: First visit, the Taj Mahal was invisible due to dense fog which took about ½ an hour to clear to the point where we could see an outline. Fog stayed with us for 2 solid days - be aware this can happen... On the way there, from town, there are some sports fields, loads of groups practising mainly cricket. Nice to stop there for some great views of the Taj Mahal as well...

title: An alternative place to enjoy Taj Mahal
review: is an alternative place to enjoy the beauty of the Taj Mahal from the other side. We can enjoy the beauty of the Taj Mahal from the edge of the Yamuna river. although the river is not drained, the bird's activities provide an amazing view especially when the sun sets. Entrance tickets are also subject to cameras and camera tripods are prohibited

title: Only worthwhile if you can see the Taj
review: This is a "garden" on the opposite side of the river from the Taj. It is not really a garden yet, as nothing is rally established yet. There is a fee of IR300 to enter, which is a rip-off.Although it was raining when we were there we had a very good view of the Taj. It is also the site of the so-called black Taj, which seems to be a bit of a myth.

title: Mehtab... to No’tab
review: DON’T PAY.

title: We Actually Wanted to Watch Sunset from Here
review: The tuktuk driver said that there are no more boat operating on Yamuna River so we can watch the sunset on this garden. I think Mehtab Bagh was a field before without the admission fee. But when we came, we were asked to pay Rs 300 just because the place got a nice view of Taj Mahal. Also, it was still undeveloped yet so it was so dusty. We can see the Taj Mahal alright, and even took some pictures. But, I think it was too overpriced.

title: Shame turned into all about $$
review: Yes it's a nice garden, if lucky a clear day good view of Taj Mahal,  with there high fenced in area,  now blocked off free river walk as well no boats alowed or walking along the river far side.  Hevan for bid we see the Taj Mahal with out paying a fee but also 28x higher fee for non national. Met many young poor budget travler who needed to chose to break there budget or go see it,  shame world coming all over high fences so we can't see historical things what next build wall around the Coliseum of Rome the Golden Gate Bridge. Sad world were become..!  Lucky for me came years ago it was free & not so much around..!  Now just another tourist trap that's over rated..!  So many other nice Temple, Tumb & Mosque  here India..  Even the park next to Taj Now has a fee..?

title: See the Taj from across the Yamuna River
review: Difficult to get to. Alot of traffic, but the gardens are nice. People go here to view the Taj at evening time, if they visited the Taj for sunrise, or during the day.

title: Overpriced!
review: One has to pay 300 roepies to walk in a poorly kept 'park' with barely a few flowers and fences everywhere (around archeological? works) that make it difficult to reach the only reason to come here: the magnificent view of the Taj Mahal.

title: Not as Good as Expected
review: We were told there were beautiful gardens and you got fantastic sunset views of the Taj Mahal. The gardens were mainly rose gardens that were without a single flower. There were a few flower beds with flowers but most were empty. Unfortunately it was overcast and we didn't even get a sunset! You do get some beautiful views of the backside of the Taj Mahal. Perhaps in a different season, with roses blooming, and on a clear day, this would be a far better experience. I would not consider this a must see if I had only limited time.

title: Uncrowded garden with views of the Taj Mahal
review: There really isn’t much to this garden. However, it wasn’t crowded at all when we were there and had nice views of the Taj Mahal across the river. The pollution was terrible, so the views were very hazy. Still, probably worth the small admission fee to be able to see it with few people in your way.

Nice to stop there for some great views of the Taj Mahal as well...

title: Mehtab... to No’tab
review: DON’T PAY.

title: We Actually Wanted to Watch Sunset from Here
review: The tuktuk driver said that there are no more boat operating on Yamuna River so we can watch the sunset on this garden. I think Mehtab Bagh was a field before without the admission fee. But when we came, we were asked to pay Rs 300 just because the place got a nice view of Taj Mahal. Also, it was still undeveloped yet so it was so dusty. We can see the Taj Mahal alright, and even took some pictures. But, I think it was too overpriced.

title: Not as Good as Expected
review: We were told there were beautiful gardens and you got fantastic sunset views of the Taj Mahal. The gardens were mainly rose gardens that were without a single flower. There were a few flower beds with flowers but most were empty. Unfortunately it was overcast and we didn't even get a sunset! You do get some beautiful views of the backside of the Taj Mahal. Perhaps in a different season, with roses blooming, and on a clear day, this would be a far better experience. I would not consider this a must see if I had only limited time.

title: Overpriced!
review: One has to pay 300 roepies to walk in a poorly kept 'park' with barely a few flowers and fences everywhere (around archeological? works) that make it difficult to reach the only reason to come here: the magnificent view of the Taj Mahal.

title: Shame turned into all about $$
review: Yes it's a nice garden, if lucky a clear day good view of Taj Mahal,  with there high fenced in area,  now blocked off free river walk as well no boats alowed or walking along the river far side.  Hevan for bid we see the Taj Mahal with out paying a fee but also 28x higher fee for non national. Met many young poor budget travler who needed to chose to break there budget or go see it,  shame world coming all over high fences so we can't see historical things what next build wall around the Coliseum of Rome the Golden Gate Bridge. Sad world were become..!  Lucky for me came years ago it was free & not so much around..!  Now just another tourist trap that's over rated..!  So many other nice Temple, Tumb & Mosque  here India..  Even the park next to Taj Now has a fee..?

title: See the Taj from across the Yamuna River
review: Difficult to get to. Alot of traffic, but the gardens are nice. People go here to view the Taj at evening time, if they visited the Taj for sunrise, or during the day.

title: Uncrowded garden with views of the Taj Mahal
review: There really isn’t much to this garden. However, it wasn’t crowded at all when we were there and had nice views of the Taj Mahal across the river. The pollution was terrible, so the views were very hazy. Still, probably worth the small admission fee to be able to see it with few people in your way.

title: Only worthwhile if you can see the Taj
review: This is a "garden" on the opposite side of the river from the Taj. It is not really a garden yet, as nothing is rally established yet. There is a fee of IR300 to enter, which is a rip-off.Although it was raining when we were there we had a very good view of the Taj. It is also the site of the so-called black Taj, which seems to be a bit of a myth.

title: An alternative place to enjoy Taj Mahal
review: is an alternative place to enjoy the beauty of the Taj Mahal from the other side. We can enjoy the beauty of the Taj Mahal from the edge of the Yamuna river. although the river is not drained, the bird's activities provide an amazing view especially when the sun sets. Entrance tickets are also subject to cameras and camera tripods are prohibited
